explanation: Dim or flickering displays on mobile devices are usually caused by a faulty backlight in the display panel. A failing inverter can cause these problems, too.

question: You have been troubleshooting a computer, and you believe the power supply has failed. Which of the following tools can you use to test the integrity of the power supply? (Choose two.)
explanation: If you're curious as to the state of your power supply, you can buy hardware-based power supply testers or multimeters to test it. Loopback plugs are for testing network interface cards (NICs), and POST cards are for testing motherboards.

question: A user is trying to display a presentation on a projector, but nothing appears on the external screen. They try toggling their LCD cutoff switch, and it doesn't help. Another user had just presented on the projector, and it worked fine. Which component is most likely causing the problem?
explanation: If the laptop won't output a screen image to an external display or projector, it means one of two things (assuming you know that the display or projector works): either the external video port is malfunctioning or the function keys aren't working. In either case, you likely need to replace the motherboard if you want the display to appear on an external device.

question: A mobile phone user is unable to connect the phone to their wireless headset so they can make hands-free calls. Their iPhone screen is shown here. What is most likely the problem?
options: His wireless headset is turned off.
explanation: Most wireless headsets use a Bluetooth connection. The first thing to check is that Bluetooth is enabled, which also means double-checking that Airplane mode is not turned on. In this case, Bluetooth is off.

question: Your corporate office has sent a memo that all remote offices must use a security protocol that your WAP doesn't support. What should you do first?
options: Keep using the old security protocol.
explanation: Your first step is to see if a firmware update to the WAP will provide the new security protocol that you need. You'll want to try updating the devices' firmware or software as well. During transition times, WAPs will often have a transitional security setting that will support both the older and the new devices until you can get everything updated. If you can't update your old WAP, the next step would be to look for a new WAP to use during your transition.

question: You're considering storage devices for a NAS. Some drives are HDD, and some are SSD. You need to balance drive speeds and price. What will you use to compare the drive speeds?
explanation: Input/output operations per second (IOPS) is the only way to truly compare the speed when some drives are solid state and others are mechanical. Mechanical drives often use revolutions per minute (RPM), which is also known as spindle speed, as an indication of how fast they can access data. Solid-state drives (SSDs) have no moving parts, so there is no spindle speed. Regardless of the drive type, IOPS is a better way to compare drive performance, and the only way when they are not the same type of drive. Other factors to consider are how long the drive is expected to last and drive latency.

question: Your client is running a NAS with ten 16 TB HDDs for a total capacity of 160 TB. They are complaining that the storage array's average IOPS isn't enough to keep up with company demands. What might they replace the HDDs with to maintain capacity but increase performance? (Choose two.)
explanation: HDDs have a natural speed disadvantage compared to SSDs because of their moving parts. As hard drive storage gets bigger, the performance lag is exaggerated. SSDs have no moving parts, so their latency is much lower. Either replacing the existing HDDs with several smaller drives or the same size of SSDs would increase the performance, but also the cost of the drives. IOPS is the best measure to use when comparing drive performance.

question: A routine check of IOPS of your NAS reveals that it has dropped significantly. What is a likely cause? (Choose two.)
options: The HDDs were replaced by SSDs.
The HDDs were replaced with M.2 drives.
A drive in the array has failed.
correct_answer: A drive in the array has failed.
explanation: A significant change in usage patterns can affect the IOPS on the system based on the type/size of files being transferred and the software used to do it. If a drive in the array has failed, that will also affect the maximum IOPS the system is capable of, as there is one less drive to do the work.

question: A user complains that they can barely see the image on their smartphone. Everything seems to work fine, but they can't see it. What will you do first?
explanation: A dim or flickering screen can be a sign that the display assembly needs to be replaced, but before you go that route, it's best to check the brightness or auto-brightness features. Location settings and battery are irrelevant in this situation. The battery is still working because they can see something.

question: You're at a friend's house. Your phone was working fine before you got here, and it usually works fine when you are here, but now it's taking forever to try to load a web page, and then it times out and asks if you want to use cellular data. You're at your data plan's limit. What should you do?
options: Tell it to forget this network and ask your friend for the new password.
Use your cellular data and pay the overcharges.
Check for problems with their router.
correct_answer: Check for problems with their router.
explanation: This error will happen when you have logged on to a familiar Wi-Fi but it is unable to connect to the Internet. If the password was the problem, you would have gotten an error about being unable to automatically connect, in which case you would forget the network and rejoin with the new password. You could use your cellular data, but it might be better to help the friend get their Internet connection working again instead.

question: You just installed and configured a new WAP to provide better network connectivity in a remote part of the building. When you turn your laptop on to check the connectivity, there are only a couple of bars even though you're looking up at the WAP. What do you need to do?
explanation: Improperly adjusted antennas can make a big difference in wireless connectivity. In this case, take a few minutes and a Wi-Fi analyzer to check the signal strength and adjust the antenna until it's just where you want it. You would not need to adjust the WAP's signal strength because you're right under it, looking up at it. Even on the lowest power setting you should still see more bars. The SSID being broadcast or not is irrelevant.

question: You're taking a walk around the exterior of your office building when your Wi-Fi analyzer shows that your network is visible in the parking lot. You're concerned that an unauthorized person can connect to your wireless network. What should you do?
explanation: Setting a WAP to transmit at the maximum power may cause the Wi-Fi to extend into areas you would rather it didn't. It can also cause problems like more interference causing poor performance and stability because it's picking up signals from nearby Wi-Fi networks. Enabling or disabling the SSID broadcast will have no effect on the signal strength. It may take a bit of playing with settings, antennas, and placement to get the Wi-Fi transmission exactly how you need it to be, but in this case, lowering the WAP's power setting is a good start.

question: Your Wi-Fi network is experiencing some interference, which is causing poor performance and making it unstable. Which of the following might help? (Choose two.)
explanation: The answer will depend on the exact situation, but if your WAP is experiencing interference from other WAPs or networks, you may want to lower, rather than raise, the signal strength. You would want to run a network analyzer and choose the channel with the least traffic, or optionally, if the WAP allows, let it choose the best channel for you. Installing an antenna with a lower gain might also work.

question: A user reports that their new inkjet printer prints random alphanumeric characters instead of their desired output. Which of the following actions is likely to resolve this problem?
explanation: The issue is likely due to an invalid device driver, which causes the printer to output garbled text. Reinstalling the correct driver from the manufacturer, preferably the latest version from their website, should resolve the problem. Other options are incorrect because the maintenance utility is for physical issues like clogged nozzles, replacing ink cartridges doesn't address a software interface problem, and power cycling won't fix an incorrect driver installation.

question: A technician completes the repair of a printer extruder. What should the technician do to test the repair?
explanation: Since the technician just repaired the extruder on a 3-D printer, the next logical step is to load the filament to test it. Filament-based printers work by melting and depositing layers of filament through the extruder. The other options are irrelevant as they pertain to different types of printers: resin is used in resin-based 3-D printers, ribbons are used in impact printers, and fusers are components in laser printers.

question: A technician discovers that a laser printer suffers frequent paper jams and streaking. The technician has replaced the print paper and verified the paper cartridge is seated properly, but the issue remains. What should the technician do to address this problem?
explanation: A worn or dirty transfer roller can cause paper to jam or feed improperly, leading to the issues described. The print drum is typically replaced when streaks or spots appear on prints. A tractor feed is a component of impact printers , and a carriage belt is used in inkjet printers; neither is relevant to this laser printer issue.

question: A company's president recently lost their laptop, which resulted in stolen data. A technician has been tasked with implementing biometrics to reduce this risk. What should the technician do to meet this goal?
explanation: Biometric authentication uses biological data, like a fingerprint, for identification. Enabling the fingerprint scanner, a feature common on enterprise-grade laptops, provides a high level of security because fingerprints cannot be easily stolen or guessed like passwords. While disk encryption protects data, it isn't a biometric solution. An HSM stores cryptographic keys and is not the feature to enable for biometric login. NFC-based authentication requires a separate hardware key and is not a biometric method.

question: A developer wants to test an application in an isolated environment on their laptop. Which of the following technologies should the developer consider? (Select TWO).
explanation: Both a virtual machine (VM) and a sandbox provide isolated environments for testing applications on a laptop. A sandbox separates running applications from the underlying system , while a VM is a fully virtualized operating system. VDI hosts virtual desktops on a server, not locally on a laptop , and a private cloud provides cloud computing advantages within a single organization, which is beyond the scope of testing an app on a personal laptop.

question: A customer lives in an apartment with several nearby wireless networks and wants to install a wireless access point for a home office. The customer needs to determine the best channel to use when configuring the access point. What tool should the customer use?
explanation: A Wi-Fi analyzer is the correct tool because it can show the signal strength of nearby wireless channels, allowing the customer to choose an unused or less congested channel for their access point. A signal generator is used for audio testing , a loopback plug tests wired connections , and a multimeter tests cable continuity.

question: A user reports that their laptop's LCD screen is dim and nearly unreadable. They restart the laptop but it does nothing to correct the problem. Which component do they need to replace?
explanation: The inverter is the component responsible for providing power to the backlight of an LCD display. When it fails, the screen becomes very dim. The issue is not the LCD panel itself, which doesn't provide its own light ; the digitizer, which is for touch input ; or the video adapter, which would likely cause no display or a corrupted display if it were failing.

question: What is the approximate maximum indoor range for a wireless router using the 802.11g protocol?
explanation: The maximum indoor range for the 802.11g wireless protocol is approximately 125 to 150 feet. Other 802.11 standards have different ranges: 802.11a, 802.11b, and 802.11ac have an approximate indoor range of 115 feet, while 802.11n reaches about 230 feet. No current 802.11 standard supports an indoor range of 600 feet.

question: You are selecting a power supply to install in a computer. What should you do?
options: Install the lowest wattage power supply that matches your motherboard's form factor.
Determine wattage requirements by adding the requirements for all motherboard components, hard drives, and peripherals.
Install the highest capacity power supply that matches your motherboard's form factor.
Determine capacity requirements by adding the requirements for the hard drive and all peripherals.
correct_answer: Determine wattage requirements by adding the requirements for all motherboard components, hard drives, and peripherals.
explanation: To select the correct power supply, you must calculate the total wattage needed by summing the power requirements of all components, including those on the motherboard and all peripherals. Choosing the lowest wattage might not be sufficient , and choosing the highest capacity is unnecessary. You must consider motherboard components, not just peripherals and hard drives.

question: A customer brings in a smart phone and complains that the phone's display is too dark. The auto-brightness control is enabled on the phone. The customer has tried restarting the phone. What should the assistant try first?
explanation: The most likely cause is that the phone's light sensors need to be recalibrated. Resetting the auto-brightness feature is the first and least invasive step. This can often be done by turning auto-brightness off and on in a dark environment. Resetting the entire phone is a more drastic step that would erase user data and should be tried later if necessary. Cleaning the port or recharging the battery are unlikely to fix a sensor calibration issue.

question: A customer is synchronizing mail, contact, calendar, and bookmark information from an iOS phone and an iPad to iCloud. The customer is using a computer running Windows 10 with Outlook 2016 for this synchronization. What does the customer need to do?
options: Install iCloud for Windows on the computer.
Install Outlook on the iPad or iPhone.
correct_answer: Install iCloud for Windows on the computer.
explanation: To synchronize iCloud data with a Windows 10 PC and Outlook, the customer must install the "iCloud for Windows" application. This software allows for the configuration of sync options for mail, contacts, and calendars with Outlook 2010 and later. There is no need for an additional iCloud account, an upgrade to Windows 11, or installing Outlook on the iOS devices for this synchronization to work.

question: A customer wants to automatically synchronize calendar and contact information from an iOS phone so that it is readily available to both the iOS phone and a laptop running Windows 10. The customer also has a desktop computer running Windows 10 in a home office. The customer wants to keep the setup requirements on the iOS phone to a minimum. The customer needs to be able to synchronize when traveling. Which of the following is the best synchronization method?
explanation: Using iCloud is the best method because it requires minimal setup on the iOS phone and automatically synchronizes data across the iOS device and Windows computers, making it accessible while traveling. Synchronizing to a desktop would not be readily available while traveling , using a USB drive would require manual effort , and using Google Drive would involve additional setup compared to the native iCloud solution.

question: A user is told that the company's policy requires L2TP IPSec to be activated on a corporate Android mobile phone. What should the user configure?
explanation: L2TP with IPSec is a popular protocol used to create a Virtual Private Network (VPN). The user needs to configure a VPN tunnel to establish a secure, encrypted connection to the corporate office. Android phones have a built-in client for configuring L2TP VPNs. Tethering is for sharing a mobile data connection, SSO is for single sign-on access to multiple apps, and S/MIME is for securing email; none of these are correct.

question: A technician is configuring a computer for use as a virtualization host. They want to install a power supply unit (PSU) that gives them options for connecting components to provide up to 18A current draw on the 12v lines, but still provides protection against over current conditions. What kind of PSU should they choose?
options: A PSU with a variable thermal-protection circuit
A PSU with a 20+4 motherboard connector
A PSU with multiple voltage rails
correct_answer: A PSU with multiple voltage rails
explanation: A PSU with multiple 12v rails provides separate current limiting circuits for different sets of 12v lines. This design offers enhanced protection against overcurrent conditions. A thermal-protection circuit protects against overheating, not overcurrent. A 20+4 connector is for motherboard compatibility. A PSU has a single 12v source, even if it has multiple rails.

question: An organization wants to maximize performance for its wireless network. Which technology should the organization deploy?
explanation: 802.11ax, also known as Wi-Fi 6, is the latest generation of Wi-Fi technology designed for the highest performance and efficiency, especially in dense environments. It uses advanced technologies like OFDMA and MU-MIMO to deliver higher throughput than previous standards like 802.11b, 802.11g, and 802.11n.

question: Which PoE standard provides up to 60W of DC power on each port?
explanation: PoE++ (Type 3), which is governed by the 802.3bt Type 3 standard, provides up to 60W of DC power per port. The other standards provide different power levels: standard PoE (802.3af) provides up to 15.4W , PoE+ (802.3at) provides up to 30W , and PoE++ (Type 4) (802.3bt Type 4) provides up to 100W.

question: Which statements correctly characterize network cable types and their usage? (Select TWO).
options: STP cable is more resistant to interference than UTP cable.
Fiber optic cable is primarily used for networking within a single building.
STP cabling is limited to up to 500 meters.
Plenum-rated cable is primarily used to reduce EMI.
correct_answer: STP cable is more resistant to interference than UTP cable.
explanation: Shielded Twisted Pair (STP) cable contains metal shielding that minimizes electromagnetic interference (EMI) more effectively than Unshielded Twisted Pair (UTP) cable. Category 6 (Cat 6) cabling is capable of supporting 10GBASE-T (10-Gigabit Ethernet) standards. The other statements are incorrect. Fiber optic cable is used for faster transmissions over longer distances, not just within a single building. STP cabling has a length limit of 100 meters, not 500. Plenum-rated cable is used in spaces with airflow (plenums) for fire safety, not to reduce EMI.

question: A technician is troubleshooting a potentially faulty server power supply. Which task should the technician perform?
options: Verify that the power input is 12 volts.
Ensure that the power supply provides 5-volt standby.
Verify that the power supply is supplying 3.5, 5, and 12 volts.
Ensure that the 24-pin connector is seated properly.
correct_answer: Ensure that the 24-pin connector is seated properly.
explanation: A primary troubleshooting step is to check physical connections. The 24-pin connector is the main power connection from the PSU to the motherboard, and if it's not seated properly, the system won't receive power correctly. Verifying specific output voltages (which are typically 3.3V, 5V, and 12V, not 3.5V) is a more advanced step. The input voltage from the wall socket is much higher (100-220V AC), not 12V. 5-volt standby is a useful but not essential feature for basic function.

question: A technician is helping to set up a SOHO network. They have been asked to implement QoS support on the network. Which of the following would be the most likely to require QoS support?
explanation: Quality of Service (QoS) is crucial for Voice over Internet Protocol (VoIP) because it prioritizes voice traffic packets to reduce delays and ensure clear communication. Services like email and instant messaging are not as sensitive to packet delays and do not require QoS. The SSID is the name of a wireless network and is unrelated to QoS.

question: During a presentation, a projector unexpectedly turns off. After checking the power cable, the technician is able to turn the projector on, but it turns off several minutes later. What should the technician do NEXT to determine the cause of this issue?
options: Check whether the bulb has exceeded its usage hours.
Check that the display cable is seated properly.
Check that the projector's fan is operational.
correct_answer: Check that the projector's fan is operational.
explanation: Projectors generate significant heat, and a malfunctioning fan can cause the projector to overheat and shut down due to a thermal safety switch. This behavior (working for a few minutes before shutting down) is a classic symptom of overheating. An aging bulb would likely cause a dim image, not a shutdown. A bad display cable would affect the image but not cause the projector to power off.

question: An organization plans to enhance authentication by ordering laptops with biometric devices. A technician has been asked to recommend a device or technology that uses biometrics as a means of authentication or verification. To minimize costs, the solution should be integrated with the laptop and should not require the purchase of additional hardware. What should the technician recommend?
explanation: Face recognition is a biometric authentication method that uses biological data (facial features) to verify a person's identity. Since most modern laptops come with a built-in camera, this solution can be implemented without additional hardware costs, meeting the requirements. A near-field scanner (NFC), a digitizer (for stylus input), and SCADA (industrial control system) are not biometric authentication technologies.

question: A company uses an online database to store information about all production servers. A technician receives a request to add three servers to the database based on the description provided. How should the technician categorize the servers?
options: The server is Linux-based. It runs the RADIUS protocol to grant access to VPN users.
The server has three TCP ports open: 110, 25, and 143.
The server is used to collect firewall logs.
correct_answer: Description: The server is Linux-based. It runs the RADIUS protocol to grant access to VPN users. Server category: Authentication servers
Description: The server has three TCP ports open: 110, 25, and 143. Server category: Email servers
Description: The server is used to collect firewall logs. Server category: Syslog servers
explanation: A server running RADIUS is used for checking credentials and granting access, which makes it an authentication server. TCP ports 25 (SMTP), 110 (POP3), and 143 (IMAP) are all standard protocols used for sending and receiving email, identifying the server as an email server. A server that acts as a central repository for network and system logs, such as firewall logs, is known as a syslog server.

question: A user plans to purchase a new iPhone at an Apple Store. What should the user do with their current iPhone to ensure a seamless transition prior to entering the store?
options: Back up the iPhone to their computer.
Purchase a USB data transfer cable.
Send the configuration details of the iPhone to the Apple Store.
explanation: Synchronizing the old iPhone to iCloud allows an Apple Store technician to easily restore the user's data and settings onto the new device from the cloud, ensuring a seamless transition. Backing up to a computer is not ideal as the computer would need to be present at the store. A USB cable is not needed for this type of data transfer, and sending configuration details is not a required step.

question: Which should be used to provide AAA functionality for networked systems?
explanation: RADIUS (Remote Authentication Dial-In User Service) is a networking protocol that provides centralized Authentication, Authorization, and Accounting (AAA) management for users who connect to and use a network service. The other options are incorrect: SCADA is for industrial control systems, UTM is a comprehensive security solution, and NFC is for short-range communication.

question: A company plans to implement a bring your own device (BYOD) policy. To minimize the risk of stolen data, management wants to ensure that devices are configured securely. What should the company do to meet this requirement?
options: Deploy a centralized MDM solution and enroll users' smartphones before use.
Enable two-factor authentication for access to all company resources.
Enable geolocation support on devices and configure GPS policies.
Configure MAM and specify policies for managing phone settings.
correct_answer: Deploy a centralized MDM solution and enroll users' smartphones before use.
explanation: Mobile Device Management (MDM) software is the comprehensive solution for managing and securing mobile devices. It allows an organization to enforce security policies, remotely lock or wipe a device, and manage applications, thus ensuring the devices are configured securely. MAM only focuses on applications, two-factor authentication secures access but not the device itself, and geolocation alone does not ensure secure device configuration.

question: Users start complaining about slow performance when retrieving data from the NAS. Performance when accessing other network resources is not affected. What is the most likely cause?
options: The network is experiencing an external attack.
Disk fragmentation has reached a critical level.
explanation: In a RAID 5 configuration, which is common for a NAS, the failure of a single hard disk will not cause data loss but will significantly slow down read performance because the data from the failed drive must be regenerated from parity information on the remaining drives. The failure of multiple disks would cause the entire RAID subsystem to fail, resulting in data inaccessibility, not just slow performance. An external attack would likely affect the entire network, not just the NAS.

question: A laser printer is printing dim printouts. What is the most likely cause of the problem?
options: The fuser assembly needs to be replaced.
The drum or imaging kit needs to be replaced.
correct_answer: The drum or imaging kit needs to be replaced.
explanation: A common cause of dim printed images from a laser printer is a drum or imaging kit that is at the end of its life. Damp paper or dirty rollers typically cause paper jams, not dim prints. A failing fuser assembly would result in toner that does not adhere to the page and can be rubbed off easily.

question: Which statement correctly describes SDN?
options: Using SDN, network devices can be provisioned and configured using automated, pre-programmed processes.
Using SDN, network devices can receive power through the same Ethernet cable that is used for data connectivity.
SDN facilitates a fiber-optic connection between a private network and an internet service provider.
SDN is a security solution that offers a comprehensive and coordinated approach to defending against network threats.
correct_answer: Using SDN, network devices can be provisioned and configured using automated, pre-programmed processes.
explanation: Software-Defined Networking (SDN) is a network architecture that allows administrators to centrally and programmatically control and manage network devices like switches and routers through software. This enables automated provisioning and configuration. The other options describe different technologies: Power over Ethernet (PoE) , an Optical Network Terminal (ONT) , and Unified Threat Management (UTM).

question: A mobile device customer frequently travels outside of provider service areas. The customer often has problems making roaming connections and often incurs high roaming charges. The customer needs to ensure that connections are made through preferred roaming partners. What should the customer update?
explanation: The Preferred Roaming List (PRL) is a database on the phone that tells it which networks to connect to when roaming. Updating the PRL ensures the device uses the provider's preferred partners, which can resolve connection issues and help avoid high charges. PRI contains technical network settings, IMEI is a unique device identifier, and IMSI is a unique subscriber identifier stored on the SIM card; none of these are related to roaming partner selection.

question: Which of the following technologies requires a hypervisor? (Select TWO).
explanation: A hypervisor is the software, firmware, or hardware that creates and runs virtual machines (VMs). Virtual Desktop Infrastructure (VDI) is a technology that hosts desktop environments on a centralized server in the form of VMs. Therefore, both VMs and VDI fundamentally rely on a hypervisor. VPN, VLAN, and VA (Vertical Alignment, a type of LCD) do not require a hypervisor.

question: A customer has a problem with a laser printer. The print quality is good visually, but the toner rubs off easily, leaving black streaks. What is the most likely cause?
explanation: The fuser assembly is responsible for using heat and pressure to melt and permanently bond the toner to the paper. If the toner rubs off easily, it indicates the fuser is not getting hot enough to complete this process, and the assembly likely needs to be replaced. A bad transfer corona would likely result in a blank page, while damp paper or dust would cause other issues like paper jams or random white spots.

question: A customer reports that they hear a loud, periodic clicking sound from within the computer chassis. Which of the following is the MOST likely cause of this problem?
explanation: A loud, periodic clicking sound is a classic symptom of a hard drive head crash, where the read/write heads are physically hitting the disk platters. This is a critical issue that signals imminent drive failure and potential data loss. The other options are unlikely to cause this specific sound. An overpowered fan would create a whirring or buzzing noise. An aggressively overclocked CPU might produce a popping sound and smoke if it burns out. Incorrectly installed RAM would likely prevent the computer from starting at all.

question: A technician has been unable to correct a problem on a computer. Another member of the team wants to use a methodical troubleshooting process to help them determine if the original technician missed anything. Arrange the entries in the order in which they should be performed.
options: Establish a theory of the cause.
Test your theory of the cause.
correct_answer: 2. Establish a theory of the cause.
3. Test your theory of the cause.
explanation: This sequence follows the CompTIA recommended troubleshooting methodology, which provides a structured approach to problem-solving. The process begins with identifying the issue, theorizing a cause, testing that theory, creating a plan, implementing it, verifying the fix, and finally, documenting everything.

question: Which of the following is the MOST likely reason for an organization to choose a hybrid cloud deployment model?
options: To eliminate the need for locally hosted compute resources
To consolidate all cloud resources to a single data center
To augment on-premises resources by providing overflow capacity
To ensure that charges are only incurred when cloud resources are utilized
correct_answer: To augment on-premises resources by providing overflow capacity
explanation: A key feature of the hybrid cloud model is "cloud bursting," which allows an organization to use public cloud resources when their private, on-premises resources reach full capacity. This provides overflow capacity without having to invest in more local hardware. A hybrid model, by definition, does not eliminate local resources or consolidate everything into a single data center. The pay-as-you-go model is characteristic of a public cloud deployment.

question: A small business with a mixed network of wired and wireless Windows devices wants to set up a shared printer. They want to be able to print from all devices and easily relocate the printer. What should the customer set up? (Choose the BEST answer.)
options: A printer attached directly to a computer
explanation: A Wi-Fi network-attached printer is the best solution because it is easy to install and allows for simple physical relocation. It can be accessed by both wired and wireless devices on the network. A wired printer would be difficult to relocate. A Bluetooth printer might have range limitations and compatibility issues with desktops. A printer shared from a computer is more complex to configure. AirPrint is an Apple technology and would require special setup for Windows PCs.

question: A customer wants to deploy a new IP phone. They find a label on the device that says PoE-enabled. What device should be installed in the local area network to support this phone?
explanation: A Power over Ethernet (PoE) switch is the correct device to install. It provides both network connectivity and electrical power over a single standard Ethernet cable, which eliminates the need for a separate power adapter for the IP phone. Firewalls, computers, and batteries do not typically offer PoE features.

question: Which type of cable should a technician use to eliminate the possibility of electromagnetic interference (EMI)?
explanation: To completely eliminate EMI, the technician must use fiber optic cable. This type of cable transmits data using pulses of light instead of electrical signals, making it immune to electromagnetic interference. While Shielded Twisted Pair (STP) cable can reduce EMI, only fiber optic cable eliminates it entirely. UTP and coaxial cables are both susceptible to EMI.

question: A customer wants to add a RAID array to their computer. They want to be able to use disk striping with mirroring. Which RAID level does the new hardware need to support?
explanation: RAID 10, also known as RAID 1+0, is the correct choice because it combines the features of RAID 1 (mirroring) for fault tolerance and RAID 0 (striping) for improved performance. RAID 1 only provides mirroring, RAID 5 uses striping with parity, and RAID 6 is similar to RAID 5 but can withstand the loss of two disks.

question: A mini-PCI wireless adapter was replaced in a laptop and the correct driver was installed. The adapter appears correctly in Device Manager, but Windows reports no wireless networks are in range, despite other nearby computers having strong signals. What is the most likely cause of the problem?
options: A power cable to the adapter was not attached.
The antenna wires were not properly connected.
The correct driver for the adapter was not installed.
correct_answer: The antenna wires were not properly connected.
explanation: The most likely cause is that the internal antenna wires were not connected to the wireless adapter during installation. Without the antenna, the adapter cannot detect wireless networks, even though it appears to be functioning correctly in Device Manager. Mini-PCI cards draw power from the slot and do not have separate power cables. An incorrect driver would likely cause an error in Device Manager, and a disabled adapter would prevent the Wi-Fi section from appearing in Networks at all.

question: A user needs to use an LED projector to present from their laptop, but the projector displays a 'NO SIGNAL' message. Which action should they take FIRST to resolve this issue?
options: Switch the input on the projector.
Verify that the projector is plugged into the laptop.
correct_answer: Verify that the projector is plugged into the laptop.
explanation: The first step in troubleshooting a 'NO SIGNAL' error is always to check the physical connection between the source device (the laptop) and the display device (the projector). Before trying other solutions like changing inputs or restarting devices, you must confirm that the cable is securely plugged in at both ends.

question: Which network protocol uses port 21?
explanation: File Transfer Protocol (FTP) uses port 21 for its control channel to transfer files between computers. The other protocols use different ports: SSH uses port 22, HTTP uses port 80, and HTTPS uses port 443.

question: An organization deploys standard laptops for all employees. To conserve battery power, a technician has been asked to minimize RAM voltage requirements. What should the technician do?
explanation: To minimize voltage requirements and thus conserve battery power, the technician should install DDR5 RAM. DDR5 modules operate at the lowest voltage, typically 1.1 volts. In comparison, older RAM types require higher voltages: DDR4 uses 1.2V, DDR3 uses 1.3V to 1.5V, and DDR2 uses 1.8V.

question: A customer wants to install a contactless payment point-of-sale (POS) terminal but is worried about interference with existing Wi-Fi and Bluetooth peripherals. What type of connection is used for these POS transactions?
explanation: Contactless payments use Near Field Communication (NFC) technology. NFC operates on a different frequency spectrum (13.56 MHz) than Wi-Fi or Bluetooth and uses low-power magnetic loop induction over a very short range (within 4 inches), so it does not interfere with them. A Lightning connection is a wired Apple-specific connector.

question: A user tests suspicious software using client-side virtualization. Which of the following aspects should the user be MOST concerned about?
explanation: The user's primary concern should be VM escape. This is a security exploit where malicious software breaks out of the isolated guest virtual machine and gains access to the host computer's resources, potentially leading to data theft or system damage. RDP access, firewall rules, and proxy requests are general networking concepts and not the most critical vulnerability in this specific context.

question: A technician is creating new CAT 5e Ethernet cables at custom lengths. They need to add RJ-45 connectors to the cables they just created. Which tool should the technician use?
explanation: The technician should use a crimper to attach the RJ-45 connectors to the Ethernet cable. A network crimping tool is specifically designed to cut the cable, strip the insulation from the wires, and securely fasten the connector to the end of the cable. A cable tester is used to check for faults after the cable is made, a loopback adapter tests network ports, and a multimeter measures electrical properties like voltage and resistance.

question: Which server can act as a centralized authentication server in a network?
explanation: An Active Directory domain controller is a Microsoft server that runs Active Directory Domain Services (AD DS) and is designed to act as a centralized authentication server. It authenticates users, enforces policies, and provides centralized management. A DNS server resolves names to IP addresses, an Exchange server handles email, and a proxy server caches web traffic and enforces network policies.

question: A user recently purchased an external USB hard drive for their Apple iMac computer. They need the disk to use all macOS features, including Apple FileVault encryption. What should they do?
options: Run a malware scan on the drive.
explanation: To enable all native macOS features like FileVault, the user must format the drive with a native macOS file system, such as Hierarchical File System Plus (HFS+). Formatting writes the necessary file system structure to the disk. Partitioning simply creates logical boundaries and doesn't install a file system. Defragmenting and malware scanning are unrelated to enabling OS-specific features.

question: Which of the following is the primary benefit of moving a datacenter to the cloud?
options: Increased security of stored and transmitted data
Reduced costs associated with patch management
Increased elasticity in response to seasonal workload
Reduced reliance on redundant internet connections
correct_answer: Increased elasticity in response to seasonal workload
explanation: The primary benefit of moving to the cloud is increased elasticity, which is the ability to easily and quickly scale resources up or down based on demand. This is ideal for handling seasonal workloads, such as an e-commerce site during the holidays. Moving to the cloud does not inherently increase security, reduce patch management costs (as users are still responsible for their OS and apps), or reduce the need for redundant internet connections.

question: A user complains of display burn-in on their tablet. What should a technician do to troubleshoot this issue?
options: Determine if the display shows permanent discoloration.
Determine if the battery is holding a full charge.
Determine if the screen has an auto-dimming timer.
Determine if the digitizer is faulty or non-responsive.
correct_answer: Determine if the display shows permanent discoloration.
explanation: To troubleshoot burn-in, the technician must first confirm if the issue is indeed permanent discoloration. Burn-in occurs when a static image is displayed for too long, causing it to become permanently imprinted on the screen, a common issue with OLED displays. A faulty digitizer affects touch input, and battery issues or auto-dimming timers are not direct causes of screen burn-in.

question: A technician needs to modify the boot order on a computer but is locked out of the BIOS by a password. The BIOS chip is socket-mounted. After turning off and unplugging the computer, what should they do next?
options: Disconnect the motherboard power cables, wait a few minutes, and then reconnect the cables, restore power, and restart.
Wait at least five minutes, restore power, and restart.
Restore power to the computer, insert a bootable CD, and restart the computer.
Remove the CMOS battery from the motherboard for a few minutes, and then replace the battery, restore power, and restart.
correct_answer: Remove the CMOS battery from the motherboard for a few minutes, and then replace the battery, restore power, and restart.
explanation: To clear a forgotten BIOS password, the technician should remove the CMOS battery from the motherboard for a few minutes. This cuts power to the memory that stores the BIOS settings, causing them to reset to their factory defaults, which includes removing any set passwords. Simply waiting or disconnecting the main power cables will not work, as the CMOS battery will maintain the settings.

question: Which type of hypervisor should a company use to install VMs on a physical machine with no underlying operating system?
explanation: A company should use a bare metal (also known as Type 1) hypervisor. This type of hypervisor is installed directly onto the physical server's hardware and does not require a host operating system to run, giving it direct access to hardware resources. A host-based (Type 2) hypervisor requires an underlying OS. "Linux server" is an operating system, not a hypervisor type, and a "checkpoint" is a VM snapshot.

question: Which connector types are shown in the exhibit? (Select TWO).
explanation: The two connectors shown are a DisplayPort (a 20-pin connector) and a High Definition Multimedia Interface (HDMI) (a 19-pin connector). Both are used to transmit high-quality video and audio to a display device. RJ-45 is used for Ethernet networking, and DVI-D connectors have a different pin configuration.

question: Which of the following is a RAM feature that is used in critical infrastructure servers where in-memory data corruption is unacceptable?
explanation: Error Correcting Code (ECC) is the RAM feature used in critical servers to prevent data corruption. ECC technology can both detect and correct single-bit memory errors before the data is processed or stored. Parity RAM can only detect errors but cannot correct them. Buffered RAM improves memory efficiency, and "double-sided" refers to the physical layout of the memory chips; neither provides error correction.

question: A company needs a platform for the rapid development and deployment of secure, publicly accessible websites that can scale rapidly with managed services like load balancing. What kind of web solution is appropriate?
explanation: The best solution is a private Platform as a Service (PaaS) deployment. PaaS provides the development platform and infrastructure, including managed services like load balancing. A private cloud model is necessary to meet the high-security requirement during development, as only the subscriber has access to the underlying environment. The websites can still be made public after deployment. Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS) would require the client to manage the infrastructure themselves.

question: A workstation with a 4-core 3.9 GHz CPU, 8 GB of ECC RAM, and a 512 GB SATA SSD needs to be used for virtualization to run a few Windows and Linux servers. Which component should be upgraded FIRST?
explanation: The first component to upgrade is the RAM. While the CPU and SSD are adequate, 8 GB of RAM is insufficient to run multiple virtual machines simultaneously, especially server operating systems like Windows Server 2019, which requires at least 2 GB on its own. The system would perform efficiently after upgrading the RAM to 16 GB or 32 GB.

question: A customer installs an expansion card with four USB 3.0 ports to improve performance. What is the transfer rate supported by USB 3.0?
explanation: The USB 3.0 standard supports a theoretical maximum transfer rate of 5 Gigabits per second (Gb/s). This is significantly faster than the maximums for USB 2.0 (280 Mb/s) and USB 1.0 (12 Mb/s).

question: Users of a laser printer report that the printer is producing dim, ghosted images of previous pages on their printouts. What is the cause of the problem?
explanation: Ghosted images are typically caused by a broken cleaning blade. The cleaning blade is responsible for removing excess toner from the drum after a page is printed. When it fails, leftover toner from the previous page creates a faint, ghosted image on the next page. A bad fuser causes smeared printouts, a bad transfer corona causes blank pages, and a damaged drum usually causes spots or streaks.

question: You are configuring a host firewall. You need to ensure that the computer cannot respond to Telnet requests. Which port should you block?
explanation: To block Telnet requests, you must block port 23, which is the port used for Telnet traffic. Telnet is considered insecure because it transmits data in clear text; Secure Shell (SSH) on port 22 is the recommended alternative. The other ports are used for different services: port 21 is for FTP, port 110 is for POP3 (e-mail), and port 443 is for HTTPS.

question: A customer brings a smartphone in for repair because the internal speaker is not working. The technician has already checked the volume, cleaned the speaker grille, and restarted and reset the phone. What should they do next?
explanation: The next least invasive step is to clean the docking/charging port. Dirt or debris in the port can trick the phone into thinking it is docked, which would disable the internal speaker. This should be tried before moving on to more invasive procedures that require disassembling the phone, such as reseating connections or replacing chips.

question: A user on a large routed WAN is unable to reach a server on a remote subnet, and other local users have the same issue. The technician needs to determine where the communication is failing along the network path. What should they use?
explanation: The technician should use the tracert command (or traceroute on UNIX/Linux). This utility traces the path that packets take to a destination, sending a message to each router (or "hop") along the way and reporting the results. This allows the technician to identify which router in the path is failing and causing the communication breakdown. Ping only tests end-to-end connectivity, netstat displays network statistics, and netdom is for Active Directory management.

question: A graphic artist's LCD monitor is showing several black pixels that remain even after a restart. The technician needs to resolve this quickly and at minimal cost. What should they do?
explanation: The black pixels indicate that multiple pixels on the LCD panel have failed (dead pixels). This is a hardware fault within the monitor itself that cannot be repaired by the user. Therefore, the only solution is to replace the display. Changing resolution, refresh rates, the video adapter, or the cable will not fix dead pixels.

question: A technician plans to migrate a user's SSD from a seven-year-old Windows desktop to a new laptop. Once this migration is complete, what issue is the user MOST likely to encounter?
options: Some devices on the laptop may not function.
The user will not be able to authenticate.
Secure boot will prevent the system from booting.
The laptop will be unable to read data from the SSD.
correct_answer: Some devices on the laptop may not function.
explanation: The most likely issue is that some devices on the new laptop may not function correctly. The Windows installation on the old SSD has drivers installed specifically for the desktop's hardware. When moved to the new laptop, which has different hardware, the existing drivers will not match, and any devices that require custom drivers will fail to work until the correct ones are installed. The system may still boot, and authentication will likely work since it's stored locally.

question:
A technician needs to deploy a device that supports the following consolidated security services through a single platform:

- Incoming and outgoing traffic filtering
- Detecting and responding to traffic anomalies
- Virus detection
- Web content filtering
- Spam detection

What type of device should the technician use?
explanation: The technician should use a Unified Threat Management (UTM) system. A UTM is an all-in-one security appliance that integrates a wide range of security services, meeting all the listed requirements in a single, easy-to-manage platform. While a firewall filters traffic and an IDS/IPS detects and responds to threats, neither provides the full suite of services like virus detection and spam filtering that a UTM does.

question: For auditing purposes, a customer wants to receive a list of active physical addresses in the local network. What device should the customer use to generate the report?
explanation: The customer should use a managed switch. A switch builds and maintains a Media Access Control (MAC) address table to direct traffic efficiently within the local network. A managed switch allows an administrator to view and export this table, which provides a list of all active physical (MAC) addresses on the network. A hub is a legacy device that cannot learn MAC addresses, and a firewall or IPS serves different security functions.

question: A small business is concerned about employees booting company PCs from CD, DVD, or USB drives. Employees should be able to boot from the internal hard disk only. How should the computers be configured to ensure this? (Select TWO).
explanation: To solve this, you should first configure the boot order in the BIOS to only include the internal hard disk, removing other devices like CD/DVD and USB drives from the sequence. Second, you must set the BIOS supervisor password to prevent unauthorized users from entering the BIOS setup and changing the boot order back. Other password types (user or hard disk) and features like TPM or Auto-Detection do not address this specific requirement.

question: A technician is building a computer for CAD/CAM applications, which will involve a lot of 3D rendering where performance is critical. The ATX motherboard has four color-coded DDR3 memory slots and supports dual-channel architecture. The customer wants 8 GB of RAM. What should the technician do?
options: Install two 4 GB memory modules in different colored slots.
Install two 8 GB memory modules in the same colored slots.
Install a single 8 GB memory module.
Install two 4 GB memory modules in the same colored slots.
correct_answer: Install two 4 GB memory modules in the same colored slots.
explanation: To achieve 8 GB of RAM and take full advantage of the dual-channel memory architecture for maximum performance, the technician should install two 4 GB memory modules in the same colored slots. The matching colors indicate a memory channel, and populating both slots in a channel enables the more efficient interleaved memory access. Installing a single module or modules in different colored slots would result in less efficient single-channel operation.

question: A user reports that when they turn on their computer, it plays three beeps, and over the course of the work day, it slows to a crawl during normal local application use. Which of the following hardware subsystems should they investigate first?
explanation: The technician should investigate the Random Access Memory (RAM) first. A gradual system slowdown is a common symptom of faulty RAM modules. Furthermore, a three-beep code on startup often indicates a RAM issue. Storage problems typically result in consistently slow performance, not a gradual decline, and CPU issues are more likely to cause system freezes or reboots. The issue is with local applications, so the network is not the primary suspect.

question: A customer complains that their smartphone's touchscreen is unresponsive. They have already tried restarting and resetting the phone. What should the customer try next?
options: Remove the battery, wait, and then replace the battery.
explanation: Since the customer has already performed the basic troubleshooting steps of restarting and resetting the phone, the next logical step is to contact the manufacturer for repair. An unresponsive touchscreen after a reset indicates a likely hardware failure that a typical customer is not qualified to fix, such as resetting internal connections. Removing the battery is unlikely to help if a full reset did not, and the customer already performed a factory reset.

question: A technician adds a second hard drive to a user's workstation. During the next boot, the technician receives a Blue Screen of Death (BSOD). The technician must ensure the system boots properly with the new hard drive installed. What should the technician do to troubleshoot this issue?
options: Verify that the RAM has not been unseated.
Check the new drive's power cable.
Check the boot order in the BIOS.
Verify that the new drive is connected.
correct_answer: Check the boot order in the BIOS.
explanation: The most likely cause of the BSOD is an incorrect boot order in the BIOS. After installing the new drive, the BIOS may have set it as the primary boot device. Since this new drive doesn't have an operating system, the computer fails to boot and crashes. The technician needs to enter the BIOS and ensure the original hard drive with the operating system is set as the first boot priority.

question: A user reports that their desktop computer shows the incorrect date and time. A technician corrects it, but the next day the date and time are wrong again. What should the technician do to determine why the computer is unable to maintain the correct time?
options: Check that the POST is completing without errors.
Check whether the system uses a central time server.
Check if the CMOS battery has failed.
Check that the date and time are set in the BIOS.
correct_answer: Check if the CMOS battery has failed.
explanation: The technician should check if the CMOS battery has failed. This battery provides power to the CMOS chip, which stores the system's time and BIOS settings even when the computer is turned off. If the battery fails, the computer loses these settings every time it's powered down, resulting in an incorrect date and time on the next startup.

question: A user is building a custom computer for editing HD video and is concerned about video throughput and rendering performance. Drag the best component choice to the appropriate spot for Processor, Video, and Disk Storage.
explanation: For the processor, a quad core CPU is recommended over a dual-core with hyperthreading because its superior performance is critical for the final rendering of videos. For video, a PCIe x16 video card should be used for its high throughput, which is essential for editing HD video. This is far superior to older standards like AGP or basic on-board graphics. For disk storage, four 3 TB solid-state drives (SSDs) are the best choice. SSDs provide significantly better read/write performance than traditional HDDs, which helps with large video files, and the large capacity is needed for HD video editing.

question: A technician wants to improve gaming performance on a laptop. They install high-performance RAM that can operate at levels higher than DDR industry standards, but it defaults to the standard speed. To configure the memory for optimal performance with minimal effort, what should the technician do?
explanation: The technician should configure Extreme Memory Profiles (XMP) in the BIOS. XMP is an Intel technology that allows the system to easily overclock high-performance RAM to its advertised speeds using pre-defined, stable profiles, which is much simpler than manually setting individual memory parameters. Serial Presence Detect (SPD) is the default standard setting and is already enabled.

question: Which of the following are components of VDI? (Select TWO).
explanation: The two key components of a Virtual Desktop Infrastructure (VDI) are a hypervisor and a connection broker. The hypervisor is the software that creates and runs the virtual machines that serve as the user desktops. The connection broker is the service that manages user connections to these virtual desktops, allocating resources and managing sessions. The other options are unrelated technologies: DVI is a display connector, a community cloud is a cloud deployment model, and reservations are used in DHCP.

question: How should a user complete the iCloud email configuration parameters for incoming and outgoing mail?
explanation: For iCloud email, the incoming mail server is an IMAP server (imap.mail.me.com) that uses port 993 with SSL enabled. The outgoing mail server is an SMTP server (smtp.mail.me.com) that uses port 587, also with SSL enabled. The username for incoming mail is the iCloud address without the "@icloud.com," while the full email address is used for outgoing SMTP authentication.

question: What type of connector is most commonly used on a UTP CAT 5e cable?
explanation: The connector most commonly used on Unshielded Twisted Pair (UTP) cabling like CAT 5e is the RJ-45 connector. It is a modular connector that accommodates the eight conductors (four pairs of wires) found in Ethernet cables. RJ-11 is for telephone wires, BNC is for coaxial cable, and ST and FC are for fiber optic cable.

question: A technician is evaluating whether to use Category 5 or Category 6 cable for their network. Which statement correctly characterizes how Category 6 cable differs from Category 5 cable?
options: Category 6 cable is certified for gigabit networks.
Category 6 cable uses a different type of connector.
Category 6 cable allows cable run lengths equivalent to fiber.
correct_answer: Category 6 cable is certified for gigabit networks.
explanation: The key difference is that Category 6 cable is certified for gigabit networks like 1000BASE-T. While Category 5e can also achieve gigabit speeds, it is not officially certified for them. Both Cat 5 and Cat 6 use the same RJ-45 connector and are limited to the same 100-meter run length, which is much shorter than fiber. Category 6 cable is more expensive than Category 5.

question: A customer's mobile phone speaker works, but physically connected headphones do not, even though the headphones work with other devices. The headphone jack is clear, and the phone has been restarted. What should the technician recommend the customer try next?
options: Remove the battery, wait a few seconds, and then replace the battery.
Have the phone serviced to replace the headphone jack.
explanation: The technician should recommend the customer reset the phone, but only after warning them about potential data loss and advising them to back up their data first. Resetting the phone to factory settings can resolve software glitches that might be causing the issue. This should be tried before resorting to a physical repair of the headphone jack. Cleaning the charging port is unlikely to help since the phone's internal speaker is working correctly.

question: A customer purchases a pair of wireless headphones for use with their smartphone but is unable to get them to communicate. What connection type do they need to configure on the smartphone?
explanation: They need to configure a Bluetooth connection. Wireless headphones and headsets use the Bluetooth standard to pair and communicate with a controlling device like a smartphone. The user will likely need to enable Bluetooth on their phone before they can pair the devices. WiFi, IR (Infrared), and cellular data are not used for this type of peripheral connection.

question: A user reports that, during 3-D printing, the extruder causes prints to come loose and move, destroying the print. What should a technician do to resolve this issue?
explanation: The technician should replace the print bed. The print bed's function is to ensure the print material adheres properly to the surface during the printing process. If the bed is not working correctly (e.g., the heated platform or adhesive surface is failing), prints can come loose, causing the print job to fail. The other components listed (fuser, resin nozzle, UV light source) are used in different types of printers (laser or resin-based) and are not relevant to this issue with a filament-based printer.

question: Which of the options shown in the exhibit should be used to access the internet on a laptop through a mobile phone?
explanation: To share a mobile phone's internet connection with a laptop (a process known as tethering), you should use the Hotspot feature. Tapping the Hotspot icon creates a portable wireless network that other devices, like a laptop, can connect to. The other options serve different purposes: Location is for location-based services, Sync is for synchronizing data, and Airplane mode disables all wireless connections.

question: A user wants to sandbox an application which is running on their workstation. What should they do?
explanation: To sandbox an application, the user should install virtualization software on their workstation. This software allows the user to create a virtual machine (VM), which is an isolated operating system environment. Running the application inside the VM provides a strong layer of separation from the host operating system, effectively sandboxing it without needing additional hardware.

question: To minimize setup effort, a user wants to use a class-compliant external USB storage device with their Windows 10 laptop computer. What should they do to enable the device?
options: Create at least one primary partition on the device.
Perform a low-level format of the device.
Install the device driver from the manufacturer's website.
Use the Plug and Play device driver.
correct_answer: Use the Plug and Play device driver.
explanation: The user should simply plug the device in and use the Plug and Play (PnP) device driver provided by Windows 10. "Class-compliant" means the hardware is designed to work with generic drivers that are already included in modern operating systems, eliminating the need to install a separate driver from the manufacturer.

question: A user needs to configure their printer to print on both sides of each page. How should they configure their print job settings?
explanation: To print on both sides of a page, the user should enable duplex printing. This option is typically found in the printer's driver settings and management software. Collation arranges multi-page documents in order, while cover and report pages are for separating and troubleshooting print jobs, respectively.

question: Which of the following protocols operate over UDP? (Select two)
explanation: Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol (DHCP) and Trivial File Transfer Protocol (TFTP) both operate over User Datagram Protocol (UDP). UDP is a connectionless transport protocol that is faster than TCP but less reliable, making it suitable for services like DHCP address assignment and simple TFTP file transfers. HTTP, HTTPS, and SSH are all connection-oriented protocols that operate over the more reliable TCP.

question: A user has a Microsoft Office 365 subscription. In which of the following cloud locations are their documents saved by default?
explanation: By default, documents created with Microsoft Office 365 are saved to OneDrive, which is Microsoft's cloud storage service. This integration allows files to be accessible from the cloud and synchronized across all devices where the OneDrive client is installed. iCloud is Apple's service, Dropbox is a third-party provider, and FTP is a standard file transfer protocol.

question: Select the appropriate port for each protocol.
explanation: These are all "well-known ports" assigned for specific services. HTTP (web traffic) uses port 80. HTTPS (secure web traffic) uses port 443. DNS (Domain Name System) uses port 53. RDP (Remote Desktop Protocol) uses port 3389. POP3 (receiving email) uses port 110.

question: A laptop that runs Windows 10 is configured with a touchscreen and a touchpad. The touchpad works correctly, but the touchscreen responds incorrectly and it is difficult to locate the active areas of the screen. A user restarts the laptop, but the problem continues. What should the user do next?
options: Disable, then enable, the touchscreen through Device Manager.
Run the calibration utility from the Control Panel.
Use Device Manager to reinstall the device driver.
correct_answer: Run the calibration utility from the Control Panel.
explanation: The next step should be to run the calibration utility. The symptoms described—incorrect response and difficulty locating active areas—strongly suggest that the touchscreen needs to be calibrated. In Windows, this can be done through the "Tablet PC Settings" utility in the Control Panel. This should be tried before more involved steps like reinstalling drivers.

question: In the exhibit, node A is a router, node B is a switch, and node C is a load balancer. Which of the following statements correctly describe the functionality provided in this network? (Select THREE)
options: Requests from nodes D and E will be algorithmically distributed across servers F and G.
Router A will perform routing table lookups when forwarding traffic from 10.10.20.0 to 10.10.30.0.
Node B will speed up web browsing by caching web requests from nodes D and E.
Node C will provide default gateway functionality for nodes D and E.
If server F fails, all requests will be automatically directed to server G.
correct_answer: Requests from nodes D and E will be algorithmically distributed across servers F and G.
If server F fails, all requests will be automatically directed to server G.
Router A will perform routing table lookups when forwarding traffic from 10.10.20.0 to 10.10.30.0.
explanation: Node C, the load balancer, will distribute incoming requests from users D and E across the two servers (F and G) using a set algorithm. Load balancers also provide redundancy; if one server (F) fails, the load balancer will detect this and send all traffic to the remaining healthy server (G). Node A, the router, is responsible for connecting different networks. When traffic needs to go from one subnet to another (e.g., 10.10.20.0 to 10.10.30.0), the router must perform lookups in its routing table to determine the correct path. Node B is a switch and does not cache web requests; that is the function of a proxy server. The router (Node A) would serve as the default gateway, not the load balancer.

question: A technician has been asked to replace the consumables on a 3-D printer. Which of the following are considered as consumables for a 3-D printer? (Select TWO).
explanation: The primary consumables for 3-D printers are the materials used to build objects. This includes filament, which is melted and deposited in layers by an extruder, and resin, a liquid that is cured or solidified by UV light. The other items listed are consumables or components for different types of printers: toner and fusers are for laser printers, ribbons are for impact printers, and a duplexer is a component for two-sided printing.

question: A technician receives reports that file download speeds from the corporate file server are unusually slow. The technician checks the RAID 5 drive array on the file server and notices an amber warning light on one of the array drives. What should the technician do to identify the download speed issue?
options: Determine if the amber light indicates a read or write drive failure.
Determine if data is being reconstructed from parity during reads.
Determine if a failed RAID controller is slowing down reads.
Determine if data is being read from the passive mirrored drive.
correct_answer: Determine if data is being reconstructed from parity during reads.
explanation: The amber light indicates that one of the drives in the RAID 5 array has failed. In a RAID 5 setup, when a drive fails, the array enters a degraded state where it must reconstruct the missing data from parity information stored on the surviving disks for every read request. This reconstruction process is computationally intensive and significantly slows down read performance, explaining the slow download speeds. RAID 5 does not use mirrored drives.

question: A technician is implementing a wireless LAN at a customer's corporate offices. The technician needs to provide the maximum data transfer rate possible. Which wireless protocol should they use?
explanation: To provide the maximum possible data transfer rate, the technician should use 802.11ac. This wireless protocol supports theoretical speeds of up to 7 Gbps and operates in the 5 GHz frequency band, offering significantly higher performance than the older 802.11a, 802.11b, 802.11g, and 802.11n standards.

question: Place the appropriate description under each numbered port shown in the exhibit of a computer's back panel.
explanation: The exhibit shows a standard motherboard I/O panel. The ports are identified as follows: 1 & 2 is the combined purple/green PS/2 port for a keyboard or mouse. 3 is the blue 15-pin D-Sub connector for VGA video. 4 is the white DVI-D port for digital video. 5 is the HDMI port for digital video and audio. 6 contains the black Ethernet port and several blue/black USB 2.0/3.0 ports. 7 is the group of multi-colored 3.5mm jacks for analog audio (line-in, line-out, microphone, etc.). 8 is the optical S/PDIF port for digital audio output

question: A user needs their computer to be configured to prevent anyone else from being able to boot it. The computer is configured with UEFI and runs Windows 10. What should the technical support staff do?
options: Set a password through the operating system.
Set a password on the hard disk drive (HDD).
Set the UEFI supervisor (or administrator) password.
explanation: To prevent the computer from booting into the operating system, the technician should set the UEFI user password. This password is required before the operating system loading process begins. The supervisor password only protects the UEFI configuration settings, an OS password doesn't prevent booting, and an HDD password encrypts the disk but doesn't stop the boot process itself.

question: When connecting to a management page of a Bluetooth-enabled speaker-phone, a user receives a pop-up window that recommends configuring a unique pin code. What is the pin code used for?
explanation: A unique PIN code is used to secure the pairing process between Bluetooth devices. This prevents unauthorized devices from connecting to the speaker-phone. Bluetooth traffic is encrypted by default using other methods, and the PIN is not related to Quality of Service (QoS) or cloud access.

question: Which of the following statements is correct regarding client-side virtualization?
options: Host resources must be shared with the guest.
Guest compute resources must be dedicated.
Guest resources include vCPUs and a hypervisor.
A host relies on a guest to manage resources.
correct_answer: Host resources must be shared with the guest.
explanation: In client-side virtualization, host resources must be shared with the guest virtual machine (VM). A VM is a simulated computer system that runs on top of a physical host and shares its resources like CPU, memory, and storage. The host operating system manages the allocation of these shared resources to the guest VMs. Resources do not have to be dedicated, and the host manages the guest's resources, not the other way around.

question: Which cable type is commonly connected to a laptop WiFi adapter for use as an antenna?
explanation: Coaxial cable is the type commonly used for the internal antennas of a laptop's WiFi adapter. These thin coaxial wires, sometimes called pigtails, are routed through the laptop's chassis and around the display to maximize signal reception. UTP, STP, and plenum cables are used for different networking or structural wiring purposes.

question: Which characteristic of a computer power supply is most significant in determining how many devices it can support?
explanation: The wattage is the most significant factor in determining how many devices a power supply can support. Wattage is the power rating of the supply, and you must choose a unit that meets or exceeds the combined power requirements of all motherboard components and peripherals. Input and output voltages are standardized, and a surge protector is a protective feature, but neither determines the power capacity.

question: The user is unable to use all of the printer's features, such as the alternate paper tray and printing on both sides of the paper. They need access to these additional features. What should the user do?
options: Download and install the latest version of the printer device driver from the printer manufacturer.
Configure the printer as the computer's default printer.
Detach the printer, reinstall Windows 10, and reconnect the printer.
Connect to the printer through the parallel connector.
correct_answer: Download and install the latest version of the printer device driver from the printer manufacturer.
explanation: The most likely reason for the missing features is that a generic Windows driver is being used. To access all of the printer's specific features, the user should download and install the latest device driver directly from the printer manufacturer's website. This driver is designed to unlock the full functionality of the device. Setting the printer as default or reinstalling Windows will not solve a driver-specific issue.

question: A customer will be taking a laptop on vacation and is concerned about their location being tracked. They still need to check email and browse the internet. What should they do? (Choose the BEST answer.)
explanation: The best action is to disable the GPS on the laptop. GPS provides the device's exact physical location. Disabling it is a major step in preventing location tracking, while still allowing the user to connect to the internet via WiFi to check email and browse websites. Airplane mode would block all communication, and disabling Bluetooth or using low power mode would not prevent location tracking.

question: A user has an application that needs to print on a multi-part carbonless form that uses a pin feed. What kind of printer should the user use?
explanation: The user should use a dot matrix printer. As an impact printer, it uses pins to strike an inked ribbon, and the physical force of the impact is necessary to transfer the image through all layers of a multi-part carbonless form. Dot matrix printers are also designed to work with the pin-feed paper described. Laser and ink-jet printers are non-impact and would only print on the top copy.

question: A user is unable to give a presentation because the projector displays a "frequency out of range" error. What should they do FIRST to resolve this issue?
options: Switch the projector to a different input.
explanation: The first thing the user should do is lower the laptop's screen resolution. A "frequency out of range" error most often occurs when the resolution set on the computer is higher than what the projector can support. Adjusting the resolution to a compatible setting should resolve the issue. In some cases, the refresh rate may be too high and would need to be lowered, not raised.

question: A user reports that an RJ45 plug on their network cable is broken. What tools should the technician use to replace the broken plug? (Select TWO).
explanation: To replace a broken RJ45 plug, the technician will need a cable stripper to remove the outer jacket of the cable and a crimper to attach the new RJ45 plug to the wires. A punch down tool is used for wall jacks or patch panels, and a loopback plug is for testing network ports.

question: Which display technology is the most energy-efficient?
explanation: Organic Light-Emitting Diode (OLED) is the most energy-efficient display technology. This is because OLED pixels generate their own light, which eliminates the need for a power-consuming backlight that is required by other LCD technologies like TN, IPS, and VA.

question: A technician needs to connect several Ethernet cables to wall jacks so new employees can access the company's network. What should the technician use to insert the cable wires into the keystone jacks that go into the wall plates?
explanation: The technician should use a punchdown tool. This tool is specifically designed to terminate Ethernet cable wires into the slotted posts of a keystone jack or patch panel. The tool pushes the wire into the slot, cutting through the insulation to make a solid connection. A crimping tool is used for attaching RJ-45 plugs to the end of a cable.

question: A technician needs to host three on-premises VMs in a public cloud. The company needs to maintain full control over those VMs after migration. Which cloud service delivery technology would be the most appropriate?
explanation: Infrastructure-as-a-Service (IaaS) is the most appropriate model.
