The other options are different networking technologies: an ONT is for fiber optic connections, a VLAN logically segments a network, and SDN is a network management architecture.

question: An administrator needs to prepare a USB thumb drive for a user. The user will plug the drive into their Windows 10 computer and transfer files of up to 6 GB to the thumb drive. Which file system should they choose?
explanation: The administrator should format the drive with NTFS (New Technology File System). NTFS is the best choice because it supports file sizes larger than 4 GB and is natively supported by Windows. FAT32 has a 4 GB maximum file size limit, making it unsuitable for the 6 GB files. HFS+ is an Apple file system, and NFS is a network file access protocol.

question: A first response team is assisting with suspected instances of cybercrime. After they arrive at the scene and the safety of all persons has been assured, what is their first priority?
options: Protect all physical and virtual evidence.
Remove, document, and securely store all storage media.
Turn off and secure all computer hardware.
correct_answer: Protect all physical and virtual evidence.
explanation: The first priority is to protect all physical and virtual evidence. This means preserving the scene exactly as it was found. Any equipment that is currently on should be left on to preserve volatile data like memory content, and any equipment that is off should be left off. Other actions, like airgapping the equipment or documenting storage media, should happen after the initial evidence preservation.

question: Which statement describes a SAN?
options: A SAN connects two or more autonomous systems within a single geographic region.
A SAN is a computer network that uses radio waves to connect devices in a single building or group of buildings.
A SAN is a dedicated network that provides access to consolidated, block level storage devices.
A SAN is a computer network that connects devices within a relatively short distance, typically within a home or office.
correct_answer: A SAN is a dedicated network that provides access to consolidated, block level storage devices.
explanation: A Storage Area Network (SAN) is a dedicated, high-speed network that provides block-level access to consolidated storage devices. This allows multiple servers to share a pool of storage resources, improving performance and utilization. The other options describe a Metropolitan Area Network (MAN), a Wireless Local Area Network (WLAN), and a Personal Area Network (PAN).

question: A customer replaces an old BIOS-based Linux server with a new UEFI-based computer. They installed the same Linux distribution, but the computer will not boot. What should they do to enable startup? (Select TWO).
explanation: To boot an older operating system on a new UEFI-based computer, the user will likely need to make two changes in the UEFI settings: Disable Secure Boot: This feature prevents the loading of unsigned drivers, which can cause issues with older or some non-Windows operating systems. Enable legacy BIOS compatibility mode: This setting makes the UEFI firmware emulate a traditional BIOS, which is necessary for operating systems that don't support UEFI booting. Enabling TPM or setting a user password are security features that will not help with this boot issue.

question: A user has a business need for a 4K-compliant monitor. Which of the following is the minimum display resolution that would be necessary to support this requirement?
explanation: A 4K-compliant monitor must support a minimum screen resolution of 3840 x 2160 pixels. This resolution is also known as Ultra HD (UHD) or 2160p. The other resolutions correspond to different standards: 2048x1080 is 2K, 2560x1440 is Quad HD (QHD), and 7680x4320 is 8K.

question: A user changes their laptop's cracked LCD panel with a new panel of the same type. The new panel works, but they are unable to detect or connect to their office's WiFi signal. What is the MOST LIKELY cause of this problem?
options: The LCD panel is interfering with the wireless signal.
The WiFi modem is incompatible with the LCD panel.
The WiFi antenna cable is disconnected.
The WiFi modem is not properly seated.
correct_answer: The WiFi antenna cable is disconnected.
explanation: The most likely cause is that the WiFi antenna cable is disconnected. In most laptops, the WiFi antenna is routed through the display assembly frame. During the process of replacing the LCD screen, it is easy to accidentally disconnect or damage this cable. The other options are highly unlikely; the WiFi modem is not touched during an LCD replacement, and an LCD panel of the same type would not cause interference or incompatibility issues.

question: A user boots up a desktop PC, but the system reports no network connection and cannot find any websites. The technician suspects the TCP/IP stack has been corrupted. What should the technician do to test the TCP/IP stack?
explanation: To test if the local TCP/IP stack is working correctly, the technician should ping the loopback interface (using the address 127.0.0.1 for IPv4). This test does not require a physical network connection and sends a signal through the internal software stack. A successful ping confirms the stack is installed and functioning. The ipconfig command only shows settings, it doesn't test functionality. Firewall rules and the MAC address are not relevant to testing the stack itself.

question: Two companies place a backup server in each other's datacenters. Which of the following cloud models describes this approach?
explanation: This approach is an example of a community cloud. A community cloud is a collaborative effort where infrastructure is shared among several organizations with common interests or goals. In this case, the companies are sharing datacenter resources for mutual backup purposes. A public cloud is available to the general public, a private cloud is for a single organization, and a hybrid cloud mixes two or more different cloud types.

question: A company has decided to buy plenum-rated cables to run between two floors of its building. What is the most likely reason for choosing this type of cable?
options: The distance between the two floors
explanation: The most likely reason for choosing plenum-rated cable is to comply with fire safety standards. These cables have a special fire-retardant jacket that does not emit toxic fumes when burned, making them required for use in plenum spaces (areas with air circulation, like above ceilings or below floors). Plenum cables are more expensive and do not offer different speed or distance ratings compared to standard PVC cables.

question: A technician is configuring a router. They need to configure a subnet with a subnet address of 192.168.128.0 that supports up to 1022 host addresses. Which address in CIDR format should the technician use?
explanation: The technician should use 192.168.128.0/22. In CIDR notation, /22 corresponds to a subnet mask of 255.255.252.0, which provides 1024 total addresses (1022 usable for hosts), meeting the requirement. A /24 mask would only support 254 hosts, while a /20 mask would support over 4000 hosts, which is more than needed. A /10 mask is invalid for the given network address.

question: A technician is troubleshooting connectivity on a workstation with both IPv4 and IPv6 addresses. They want to verify the IP stack by pinging the loopback address for each IP version. Which addresses can the technician use? (Select TWO).
explanation: The valid loopback addresses are 127.0.0.1 for IPv4 and ::1 for IPv6. A loopback address is assigned to a virtual network interface and is used for diagnostics and testing the local IP stack. ::/0 is the IPv6 default route, 255.255.255.255 is the IPv4 broadcast address, and 0.0.0.0 represents an invalid IPv4 address.

question: A customer complains about short battery life on a new phone. What should the technician recommend to increase battery life? (Select THREE).
options: Fully discharge and then recharge the battery.
Turn off the phone when not in use.
explanation: To increase battery life, the technician should recommend the following: Disable GPS and location services, as hardware radios are a major power drain. Restrict background data to prevent apps from constantly polling for updates and using power. Watch the signal strength and use Airplane mode in areas with weak or no signal, as the phone will continually draw power searching for a stronger connection. Turning the phone off completely uses more power to start up than sleep mode does, and fully discharging modern batteries can be harmful.

question: What allows the 5G network to be 10 times faster than the 4G network?
explanation: The 5G network is significantly faster than 4G because it uses a set of new high frequencies (30 GHz to 300 GHz) with shorter wavelengths. These shorter wavelengths can carry more data, which allows 5G to support more devices and achieve higher speeds. MIMO is used in modern wireless standards generally, not just 5G, while MAC filtering and RFID are unrelated technologies.

question: A client has a router connected to the internet and an Ethernet switch. What additional network device is needed to give the client wireless access to the local area network?
explanation: An Access Point (AP) is needed to provide wireless access to the local area network. The AP connects to the existing wired network (via the switch) and broadcasts a WiFi signal that wireless devices can connect to. While many SOHO routers have a built-in AP, in larger environments, a separate device is often used. A firewall is for security, a hub is a legacy connection device, and a modem is for connecting to the internet over a phone line.

question: A customer wants to set up speakers and be able to stream sound to them from a smartphone from anywhere in the room. What connection type should the customer use?
explanation: The customer should use Bluetooth speakers. Bluetooth provides a wireless connection with sufficient range to cover a room, meeting the customer's requirement. While some speakers use Wi-Fi, Bluetooth is the standard for this type of wireless audio streaming. NFC has a very short range (only a few inches) and would not work, and an audio cable would be an inconvenient wired solution.

question: A technician replaces the motherboard, processor, memory, and video adapter in a computer. When powered on, the computer starts up but then beeps several times and stops. What should the technician do?
options: Check the website of the motherboard manufacturer for the beep codes.
Check the power connection to the motherboard.
correct_answer: Check the website of the motherboard manufacturer for the beep codes.
explanation: The best course of action is to check the motherboard manufacturer's website for the meaning of the beep codes. The series of beeps indicates a specific hardware error detected during the Power-On Self-Test (POST). Looking up the codes will tell the technician exactly which component (e.g., memory, video card) is causing the problem, which is more efficient than randomly checking every component.

question: A customer purchased ink cartridges for a multifunction printer and needs advice on how to change them. The access door is on the front of the printer. Which five steps should the technician recommend, and in what sequence?
correct_answer: 3. Click the new cartridges in place.
5. Print and scan a calibration page.
explanation: This is the standard procedure for replacing ink cartridges. First, open the access door, which will cause the print carriage to move to an accessible position. Next, remove the old cartridges, and then click the new cartridges into place. After closing the access door, you should print and scan a calibration page to ensure proper alignment and print quality. You should not turn off the printer, as it needs power for the carriage to move.

question: A technician is following the CompTIA six-step troubleshooting method. They determine that the problem can be avoided in the future if proper preventive measures are applied. During which step should these measures be applied?
options: Immediately after determining the probable cause of the problem
While implementing their action plan to correct the problem
After completing all of the troubleshooting steps
explanation: Preventive measures should be implemented during step five of the troubleshooting process: Verifying system functionality. After confirming that the primary solution has worked, this is the point where you would implement any additional measures to prevent the issue from recurring.

question: Which of the following best characterizes Microsoft Office 365?
explanation: Microsoft Office 365 is an example of Software as a Service (SaaS). With SaaS, the client subscribes to a fully functional application, such as a productivity suite, and the provider is responsible for all the underlying administration and infrastructure.

question: A laser printer is experiencing paper jams. What should you do?
options: Clean the rubber guide rollers using alcohol on a fibrous cleaning towel.
Clean the fuser assembly roller with water on a fibrous cleaning towel.
Use the maintenance software to realign the guide rollers.
correct_answer: Clean the rubber guide rollers using alcohol on a fibrous cleaning towel.
explanation: Paper jams in a laser printer are often caused by dirty or worn rubber guide rollers, which are responsible for moving the paper through the printer. You should clean these rollers using alcohol on a fibrous cleaning towel to remove dirt and paper dust. If the rollers are too smooth, a non-metallic scouring pad can be used to roughen their surface.

question: A user reports that their VoIP calls seem choppy and occasionally drop. A technician suspects that congestion may be causing variation in packet delays. What should the technician do to confirm this concern?
explanation: The technician should monitor for high jitter. Jitter is the measure of variation in the delay between successive packets. For real-time applications like VoIP, high jitter means packets are arriving at inconsistent intervals, which causes the audio to sound choppy. While high latency (delay) can also be an issue, jitter specifically measures the variation in that delay.

question: A user is selecting a hard drive for a video editing computer that will be used for HD video. Performance is a critical concern. Which hard drive option should they choose?
explanation: The user should choose a 3 TB solid-state drive (SSD). For performance-critical tasks like HD video editing, an SSD offers significantly better read/write performance than a traditional hard disk drive (HDD). Additionally, editing HD video requires a large amount of storage, making the 3 TB capacity the appropriate choice over 1 TB.

question: A customer has had a tablet for over two years and complains that the battery is not charging, although the indicator lamp is illuminated when connected to the charger. What is the most likely problem?
explanation: The most likely problem is a bad battery. Lithium-ion batteries have a limited lifespan, and after two years of use, the battery has likely reached the end of its life and can no longer hold a charge. Since the charging indicator light turns on, it suggests that the charging cable and port are working correctly.

question: An organization uses VDI for all of its users. A technician plans to deploy a patch to all VDI guests. What should the technician do to ensure quick recovery in the event that the patch fails?
explanation: Before deploying the patch, the technician should create snapshots of the virtual machines (VMs). A snapshot captures the state of a VM at a specific point in time. If the patch causes problems, the technician can quickly revert the VM back to its pre-patch state by restoring the snapshot, a process that is much faster than restoring from a full system image or backup.

question: A computer has an eSATA connector on its backplane. What type of device connects to this connector?
explanation: An external Serial ATA (eSATA) connector is used to connect an external mass storage device, such as a hard disk drive (HDD) or solid-state drive (SSD). The eSATA port provides a data connection only; the external drive will require its own separate power source.

question: A technician is experiencing dropped packets over their network. They suspect a faulty router and want to determine exactly where the packets are being dropped. Which tool should they use?
explanation: The technician should use the tracert command-line utility. This tool tracks the route that data packets take to a destination, showing each 'hop' (router) along the path. By observing where the trace stops or times out, the technician can identify the specific router where packets are being dropped.

question: A user needs to install a new mass storage device on a laptop and wants to optimize disk read and write performance. Which type of device should they install?
explanation: To optimize performance, the user should install a Non-Volatile Memory Express (NVMe) solid-state drive (SSD). NVMe is a host adapter technology that connects through the high-speed PCIe bus, providing significantly better performance than interfaces like SATA or SAS. An SSD is inherently faster than a traditional HDD.

question: A CIO is concerned that employees are sharing unauthorized data. A technician has been tasked with analyzing all inbound and outbound traffic for several workstations. What should the technician do to meet this requirement?
explanation: To analyze all traffic, the technician should install a network tap. A network tap is a hardware device that mirrors all network traffic passing through it to a monitoring device, allowing an administrator to capture and inspect all communications comprehensively. While a proxy server can log web traffic, a network tap provides a more complete capture of all network activity.

question: A customer's mobile phone does not sit flat, and the back has lifted away from the phone body. The technician needs to correct the problem. What steps should be taken, and in what order?
correct_answer: 1. Remove the back of the device.
6. Dispose of the battery at an authorized disposal station.
explanation: The symptoms indicate a swollen battery, a common issue caused by overcharging, manufacturing flaws, or age. The correct procedure is to carefully remove the back and then the swollen battery. The technician should then clean the phone's battery contacts in case of leakage, install a new battery, and re-assemble the phone. Finally, the old, potentially hazardous battery must be disposed of properly at an authorized disposal station, not thrown in the trash.

question: A technician plans to replace a failed hard drive in a system. What should the technician do to ensure the maximum performance for the system?
options: Replace the failed drive using an mSATA SSD.
Replace the failed drive using an M.2 SSD.
Replace the failed drive using a 15K RPM HDD.
Replace the failed drive using a SATA SSD.
correct_answer: Replace the failed drive using an M.2 SSD.
explanation: For maximum performance, the technician should use an M.2 solid-state drive (SSD). The M.2 form factor typically uses the PCI Express (PCIe) interface, which offers significantly higher throughput (up to 7,000 MB/s for Gen4) compared to the SATA interface used by mSATA and standard SATA SSDs (max of 750 MB/s). An SSD of any kind is much faster than even a high-speed 15K RPM HDD.

question: For each of the fiber optic connectors shown, select the connector type that matches the graphic.
explanation: All three connectors can be used for single-mode or multimode fiber. The first is a Subscriber Connector (SC), which uses a snap-on mechanism. The second is a Straight Tip (ST) connector, which is spring-loaded and twists on. The third is a Lucent Connector (LC), which is smaller and snaps on similarly to an RJ-45 connector.

question: A customer complains that their phone, which they've had for eight months, is overheating to the point of being difficult to hold. No recent changes have been made other than regular updates. What should the technician suggest?
options: Replace the charger and charger cable.
Leave the phone out of its case.
explanation: The most likely cause of the phone overheating is that the battery needs to be replaced. A battery that is unstable or failing can generate excessive heat even from normal background activity. Since no other recent changes have been made to the phone, case, or charger, the battery itself is the most probable culprit.

question: An administrator manages a server with five disks configured as a RAID 5 array. One of the hard drives fails. Which actions should they perform? (Select TWO).
options: Perform a low-level format of the failed drive.
Restore the RAID array from a backup.
Repair the RAID array using a utility program.
correct_answer: Repair the RAID array using a utility program.
explanation: With a RAID 5 configuration, the failure of a single drive does not result in data loss. The correct procedure is to first replace the failed physical drive with a new one, and then use a utility program to repair (or rebuild) the array. The RAID controller will use the parity data stored on the remaining drives to reconstruct the data onto the new drive. Restoring from a backup is not necessary unless a second drive fails during the rebuild process.

question: A user needs to upgrade the RAM on their laptop computer. Which RAM form factor would be the MOST suitable option?
explanation: The user should use the SODIMM (Small Outline Dual In-line Memory Module) form factor. SODIMM modules are a smaller version of full-sized DIMM modules and are specifically designed for use in the compact cases of laptop computers. DIMMs are for full-sized computers, while SDRAM and DDR are types of RAM technology, not form factors.

question: Which statement regarding OLED is correct?
options: Each OLED emits a single color.
OLEDs are made with liquid crystals.
explanation: A correct statement is that OLEDs (Organic Light-Emitting Diodes) are foldable and rollable. Because they can be made on flexible plastic substrates, OLED displays can be bent and curved, making them ideal for wearable devices. Unlike LCDs, OLEDs do not require a backlight and are not made with liquid crystals; each OLED can emit a range of colors.

question: A user upgraded the RAM in their Windows 10 desktop from two 2 GB DDR4 modules to one 8 GB DDR4 module. After booting up, the system reports 'no bootable device has been found' and Windows fails to start. What is the MOST likely reason for this error?
explanation: The most likely reason for the error is a loose SATA cable connecting the hard drive to the motherboard. The error message 'no bootable device has been found' indicates the system cannot see the drive with the operating system. It is common to accidentally disconnect cables inside the computer case while installing or replacing components like RAM. An issue with the RAM itself would more likely result in the system not booting at all, often with beep codes.

question: A user moved from the United States to Belgium. They attach a Type E plug adapter to the power cable of their desktop computer, but the computer does not start. What should they do next?
options: Replace the power supply with a 110V single-voltage unit.
Plug in a USB power bank.
Adjust the voltage selector switch on the power supply.
correct_answer: Adjust the voltage selector switch on the power supply.
explanation: The user should adjust the voltage selector switch on the power supply. The United States uses 110V power, while Belgium uses 220V. Most desktop power supply units (PSUs) have a physical switch to select the correct input voltage, and this must be changed to match the local power grid.

question: A technician prepares to upgrade RAM in a power user's device. Which configuration provides maximum performance?
explanation: The configuration that provides maximum performance is 4x8GB modules in a quad-channel configuration. A quad-channel memory architecture utilizes four communication channels to the CPU simultaneously, offering significantly increased bandwidth compared to dual-channel or single-channel setups.

question: A floor manager reports intermittent connectivity issues on a workstation in a heavy industrial facility. A technician notices that network throughput oscillates wildly when machinery is active. What should the technician do to identify the cause?
explanation: The technician should monitor for electromagnetic interference (EMI). In a heavy industrial environment, active machinery can create strong electrical and magnetic fields that disrupt network signal transmission, causing data loss and fluctuating throughput. The issue correlates with machinery activity, making EMI the most likely culprit.

question: An organization purchases laptops for traveling executives and wants to ensure data remains secure by fully encrypting the hard drives. What should a technician do to ensure the new laptops support drive encryption?
explanation: The technician should enable the Trusted Platform Module (TPM). TPM is a hardware microchip that provides security-related functions, including the storage of cryptographic keys. Windows BitLocker drive encryption utilizes the TPM to securely store the encryption keys, making it a critical component for full-drive encryption.

question: A customer suspects a defective RAM module because the installed amount of RAM is not detected correctly. They replace the component with a known-good module, but the computer still fails to detect the memory. Which of the following is the MOST likely cause of this problem?
explanation: Since replacing the RAM module with a known-good one did not solve the problem, the most likely cause is a faulty RAM slot on the motherboard. The issue lies with the connection point for the memory, not the memory module itself. An incorrect memory reading happens during the Power-on Self-Test (POST), before the operating system and its drivers load.

question: A human resource department frequently prints sensitive information on a shared multifunction device. A technician needs to configure the device so that this information is not accidentally disclosed. What should the technician do?
options: Require sensitive print jobs to be audited prior to printing.
Require users to log on to the device before a job is printed.
Require that all print jobs submitted to the device use PCL.
Forward all print jobs to a print server that supports SMB.
correct_answer: Require users to log on to the device before a job is printed.
explanation: The technician should require users to log on to the device before a job is printed. This feature, often called 'secure print' or 'pull printing,' holds the print job in a queue until the user physically goes to the printer and authenticates themselves (e.g., with a PIN, password, or badge) to release it. This prevents sensitive documents from being left unattended in the output tray.

question: Which protocol uses port 110?
explanation: Post Office Protocol version 3 (POP3) uses port 110. It is a protocol used by local email clients to retrieve mail from a server. The other protocols use different ports: SMTP uses port 25, FTP uses ports 20 and 21, and HTTPS uses port 443.

question: A user wants Windows 10 computers on their network to receive an IP address automatically. What kind of server is needed to support this?
explanation: A Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol (DHCP) server is needed to support automatic IP address assignment. Network computers configured for automatic addressing will lease an IP address and other configuration settings from the DHCP server.

question: A company hires field engineers who run graphics and network-intensive modeling applications. The company wants to ensure the engineers have the highest speed access possible on their mobile devices. What should the company do?
explanation: To provide the highest possible speed, the company should deploy 5G devices. 5G is the latest generation of wireless networking technology and offers significantly higher performance and throughput than older standards like 4G, with peak download speeds that can reach 20 Gbps under ideal conditions. CDMA and GSM are older 2G/3G technologies.

question: A company wants to configure VLANs to improve performance. What device should the company use to configure VLANs?
explanation: To configure virtual LANs (VLANs), the company should use one or more switches. A switch is an intelligent network device that can logically group devices into subnets (VLANs) using software, regardless of their physical location. While a router can provide communication between VLANs, the VLANs themselves are configured on the switch.

question: A graphic artist reports that she has trouble drawing correctly on her laptop touchpad. She is used to drawing using pencils. What should they use?
explanation: The graphic artist should use a stylus and digitizer. A stylus is a pen-like tool that, when used with a digitizer pad, allows for natural drawing and writing techniques similar to using a pencil on paper. Other input devices like a trackball, track point, or point stick do not offer the fine control and precision required for graphic arts.

question: You have just replaced a processor in a computer and now need to add a cooling mechanism. What should you use to attach the cooling system to the processor?
explanation: Thermal paste is used to attach heat sinks and fans to processors. A heat sink usually gets attached to the processor using thermal paste, and then the fan is attached to the heat sink. Superglue would make it adhere, but it does not transfer heat properly—it would likely melt and cause a mess.

question: You need to install a new video card into a desktop computer. Which type of expansion slot is preferred today, for high-performance graphics adapters?
explanation: PCIe is the newest and fastest slot for video cards. AGP and PCI are legacy technologies. SATA is for hard drives.

question: Your Core i5 fan has a four-pin connector, but your motherboard only has a single, three-pin header with the CPU_FAN label. Which of the following is be the easiest solution to get the necessary cooling for your CPU?
options: a. Leave the plug disconnected and use only the heat sink
b. Buy a four-pin to three-pin adapter
c. Add an extra chassis fan
d. Plug the four-pin connector into the three-pin header
correct_answer: d. Plug the four-pin connector into the three-pin header
explanation: The easiest solution that works to cool your CPU is to connect the four-pin connector into the three-pin header. The missing pin allows you to control the speed of the fan. Without it, the fan will run at top speed, which is fine, albeit a little noisier. There is no four-pin to three-pin power adapter. The heat sink alone should not be relied upon for proper cooling of modern CPUs, and an extra chassis fan isn't designed to specifically help cool the CPU.

question: Which of the following allows you to perform the most complete restart of a computer, without removing power?
explanation: The reset button causes the computer to return to nearly the same point it is in when you power it on, but without the need for power cycling. Using Restart in the Start menu does not reboot as deeply as the reset button. Hibernation is a power state that completely removes power after saving the contents of RAM to the hard drive; pressing the power button is required to resume the session in the same manner as starting the computer after a complete shutdown. The power button cannot be used as a method of restarting the system.

question: You have just found out that a new BIOS upgrade exists for your computer, and you obtain a copy to install it. Which of the following is most helpful when flashing the BIOS on a desktop computer system?
explanation: None of the options are required, but a UPS is by far the most helpful among the answers in that loss of power during this procedure can range from annoying to devastating.

question: Intel and AMD have integrated which of the following, into their Atom and APU processor lines, that had not been integrated before?
explanation: These CPUs integrate the graphics processing unit (GPU). The Core i7 before them integrated the memory controller, eliminating the FSB. Math coprocessors have been integrated since the 80486DX.

question: You are replacing the motherboard in a computer that uses an AMD Ryzen 3 processor. Which CPU socket-type does the motherboard need to have?
explanation: The AMD Ryzen 3, Ryzen 5, and Ryzen 7 CPUs use Socket AM4. AM2 and AM3 are used for older processors, such as the Phenom II, Athlon II, Sempron, and Opteron. Any socket that starts with LGA in its socket name is for Intel processors.

question: You have just purchased a motherboard that has an LGA 1156 socket, for an Intel Pentium processor. Which type of memory modules will you most likely need for this motherboard?
explanation: Pentium processors in a desktop always use DIMMs. DIPs and SIMMs are earlier forms of memory that have been obsolete for many years. SODIMMs are used in laptops.

question: You press the front power button on a computer and the system boots. Later, you press it briefly and the system hibernates. When you press it again, the system resumes. Finally, you press and hold the button and the system shuts down. What is this feature called?
explanation: Soft power is the feature whereby the front power button acts as a relay to initiate various system power changes, depending on the duration that the button is held. Programmable power, relay power, and hot power are not valid power options.

question: You find out that a disgruntled ex-employee's computer has a boot password that must be entered before the operating system is loaded. There is also a password preventing your access to the BIOS utility. Which of the following motherboard components would most effectively return the computer to a state whereby you can boot the system without knowing the password?
explanation: Most motherboards have a jumper or similar momentary closure mechanism that will allow you to clear the CMOS memory of any user settings and cause the BIOS to use factory defaults, including no user or supervisor passwords.

question: You are installing a new video card into a PCIe slot. What is the combined total throughput of a PCIe 2.0 x16 slot?
explanation: The PCIe 1.1 specification provided 250 MBps of throughput per lane per direction. With the 2.x versions of PCIe, this rate was doubled to 500 MBps. As a result, each v2.0 lane is capable of a combined 1GBps. A x16 slot consists of 16 lanes, for a total bidirectional throughput of 16 GBps.

question: You are assembling a new computer and are looking at new cooling systems. Which of the following cooling systems requires the use of a pump?
explanation: Liquid cooling systems require a reservoir of liquid and a pump to circulate the liquid. It's possible that the system could malfunction, causing a mess inside the computer. Thermal paste is used to adhere a heat sink to a processor. Heat sinks and fans do not use pumps.

question: You are told by a technician, over the phone, that you need a replacement DDR SDRAM memory. What type of packaging is used for DDR SDRAM memory?
explanation: DDR SDRAM is manufactured on a 184-pin DIMM. DIMMs with 168 pins were used for SDR SDRAM. 224-pin DIMMs do not exist. DIMMs with 240 pins are used for DDR2 and DDR3 SDRAM.

question: You are installing a new computer, and the user wants to use virtualisation. Which two hardware components need to support virtual technology for this to work properly? (Please select two.)
explanation: For virtualization to work, both the CPU and BIOS need to support it. The operating system does as well. Virtualisation support may need to be manually enabled in the BIOS. RAM does not need to support virtualization, and neither does the motherboard (except for the BIOS).

question: Which computer component contains all the circuitry necessary for other components, or devices, to communicate with one another?
explanation: The spine of the computer is the system board, otherwise known as the motherboard. All other computer components plug into the motherboard. On the motherboard, you will find the CPU, underlying circuitry, expansion slots, video components, RAM slots, and various other chips.

question: A motherboard failed on a desktop PC with an Intel Core i7-8700K processor. When looking for a replacement motherboard, which CPU socket does it need to have?
explanation: The Core i7-8700K is a Coffee Lake-series processor, which uses the LGA 1151 socket. LGA 1150 sockets are for older i7s, and the LGA 1366 socket is for even older ones than that. The LGA 2066 socket is for processors with a capital X at the end of their model number.

question: A technician asks you how to get a computer's processor to run faster than it currently does. What is he trying to achieve?
explanation: Overclocking is when someone sets the speed of the processor to run faster than it was rated for. While overclocking can make a computer faster, it can also cause the processor to overheat, and it voids the warranty. Hyperthreading allows for a processor core to handle multiple processes simultaneously. Virtualization is when you create multiple virtual machines on a computer. Multicore means that the processor has more than one core—it's not a configurable option.

question: A client wants you to build a new PC for her, with a smaller case and lower power requirements. When selecting a motherboard, which form factor should you choose for a smaller size and lower power consumption?
explanation: The ITX motherboard family consists of smaller boards that fit in standard or miniature cases and use less power than their larger counterparts. ATX are 'standard'-sized motherboards in today's world. AT is a legacy form factor that was bigger than ATX. Micro ATX is smaller than ATX, but larger than ITX motherboards.

question: You are installing a new computer, and the user wants to use virtualisation. Which two hardware components need to support virtual technology for this to work properly? (Please select two.)
explanation: For virtualization to work, both the CPU and BIOS need to support it. The operating system does as well. Virtualisation support may need to be manually enabled in the BIOS. RAM does not need to support virtualization, and neither does the motherboard (except for the BIOS).

question: You need to replace memory in a desktop PC, and go to purchase RAM. When you are at the shop, you need to find the appropriate type of memory. What memory chips would you find on a stick of PC3-16000?
explanation: Remember the 8:1 rule. Modules greater than but not including SDR SDRAM are named with a number eight times larger than the number used to name the chips on the module. The initials PC are used to describe the module; the initials DDR are used for the chips; and a single-digit number after PC and DDR is used to represent the level of DDR. The lack of a single-digit number represents DDR as long as the number that is present is greater than 133 (such as PC1600). Otherwise, you're dealing with SDR (such as PC133). This means that PC3-16000 modules are DDR3 modules and are populated with chips named DDR3 and a number that is one-eighth of the module's numeric code: 2000.

question: You are training new technicians to install RAM, and pointing out differences between packages. Which of the following, are the number of pins that can be found on DIMM modules used in desktop motherboards? (Please select two.)
explanation: DIMMs used in desktop motherboard applications have one of four possible pin counts. SDR SDRAM is implemented on 168-pin modules. DDR SDRAM is implemented on 184-pin modules. DDR2 and DDR3 are implemented on 240-pin modules with different keying, and DDR4 DIMMs have 288 pins. Older dual-channel DIMM modules have 232 pins. Modules with 200 and 204 pins are used in the SODIMM line, and there are no modules with 180 pins.

question: You are purchasing a new video card for a desktop computer. For the best performance, which type of video card should you purchase?
explanation: For a video card, the best standard currently available is PCIe, and the widest channel width is x16. There are no PCI x16 or PCI x128 slots, nor is there a PCIe x128 slot. AGP is an older video expansion standard that is now obsolete.

question: You have been asked to configure a RAID 5 system for a client. Which of the following statements, about RAID 5, is true?
options: a. It provides fault tolerance but no performance improvement
b. It requires at least three drives to implement
c. It provides performance improvement but no fault tolerance
d. If multiple drives in the array fail, the data can be saved provided that one drive is still operational
correct_answer: b. It requires at least three drives to implement
explanation: RAID 5 arrays require a minimum of three hard drives to implement. If one drive fails, the data is fine and the system can still function, albeit slowly. If more than one drive fails, the system will be inoperable. RAID 5 provides both fault tolerance and a performance improvement.

question: You have a motherboard with integrated video. The video fails, so you install a video add-on card. Which of the following statements are the most accurate? (Choose two.)
options: a. The add-on card will work properly by using the integrated card's video driver
b. The add-on card will function if it is bridged to the integrated video chipset
c. The add-on card will not function properly because of the integrated video
d. For the card to work properly, you might need to disable the integrated video in the BIOS
e. The add-on card will be detected automatically and function properly if it's PCIe
correct_answer: e. The add-on card will be detected automatically and function properly if it's PCIe
d. For the card to work properly, you might need to disable the integrated video in the BIOS
explanation: Most likely, the new card will be detected and function properly once the computer is booted up. However, the driver will need to be installed. Odds are the new card will be a different model from the integrated card, which will require a new driver. On some systems, you will need to go into the BIOS and disable the integrated adapter. Bridging happens between two PCIe video adapters, not an integrated video chipset.

question: You are installing a new graphics adapter in a Windows 10 system. Which of the following expansion slots is designed for high-speed, 3D graphics adapters?
explanation: Although technically PCI could be used for graphics adapters, PCIe supports high-speed, 3D graphic video cards. PCIe offers better performance than older graphics adapters. USB and FireWire can stream video, but they are not used for attachment of internal graphics adapters.

question: Of the following voltage pairings, which one accurately represents the input and output, respectively, of power supplies and AC adapters?
explanation: Power supplies and AC adapters use standard wall outlets for an input of AC voltage, which they convert to the DC voltages required by the components to which they supply power.

question: You are installing a new hard drive and want to know if the operating system will be able to support it. What is the largest NTFS volume size supported (assuming a 64 KB cluster size as maximum)?
explanation: A fixed number of clusters is supported by each operating system, leading to a corresponding maximum volume size. If the maximum NTFS cluster size of 64 KB is used, NTFS can support a single-volume size of 64 KB less than 256 TB. When a cluster size of one sector, or 512 bytes (1/2 KB), is used, the maximum volume size reduces to 2 TB. Because of this math, 1 TB and 128 TB are incorrect answers.

question: When installing multiple add-on cards of the same type, which type of card may you need to bridge together to function as a single unit?
explanation: PCIe video cards may be bridged together, enabling two cards to function as one system. Sound cards and I/O expansion cards such as USB and eSATA cards do not have bridging capabilities.

question: You are choosing a flash standard for a client who wants the smallest flash cards possible. Which standard should you recommend?
explanation: Both SanDisk and Micron have unveiled 1TB microSD cards at Mobile World Congress.

question: You install a new NIC for a user and he asks what it does. Which of the following best characterises the functions of this device?
explanation: A network interface card (NIC) is used as a communications device. It enables the computer to talk to other computers on a network. It does not provide multimedia, input/output (such as a USB port does), or storage capabilities.

question: When replacing a power supply, which of the following tends to vary among power supplies and must be chosen properly to support all connected devices?
explanation: Power supplies are rated in watts. When you purchase a power supply, you should make sure the devices inside the computer do not require more wattage than the chosen power supply can offer. The voltage is fairly standard among power supplies, and it has nothing to do with the devices connected to the power supply. Amperage and resistance are not selling points for power supplies. Another thing that could vary is the number of power connectors—make sure the new power supply has enough to support all installed peripherals.

question: Which of the following is not a consideration when upgrading power supplies?
options: a. You might find that your power rating is not adequate on the new power supply
b. You might find that your case has a non-removable power supply
c. You might find that you do not have a matching motherboard connector on your new power supply
d. You might find that you do not have enough of the appropriate connectors, coming from the power supply, for the devices that you have installed
correct_answer: b. You might find that your case has a non-removable power supply
explanation: Personal computers do not have permanently installed power supplies. Like other electrical and electronic components, power supplies can and do fail on a regular basis. Permanently mounting a power supply to a chassis would be a disservice to the consumer. You should consider the cumulative power needs of your installed components, and you might have to obtain adapters and splitters if you do not have enough or you have the wrong types of connectors coming from the power supply.

question: You need to install a new hard drive into a desktop computer. Which of the following is not one of the three major components of a hard disk drive system?
explanation: A conventional hard disk drive system consists of the hard disk and its often-integrated controller as well as a host adapter to gain access to the rest of the computer system. The drive interface is a common component of the controller and host adapter.

question: Your goal is to build the fastest computer possible. Which of the following hard drive technologies should you choose for the fastest read performance?
explanation: M.2 and NVMe are both relatively new SSD options, and both are incredibly fast. NVMe is slightly faster, though. SATA is limited to 600 MBps transfer speeds, whereas PCIe is not. An NVMe PCIe card can sustain data read rates of about 3,500 MBps.

question: You are installing a new power supply in a desktop computer. Which of the following statements about power supplies is true?
options: a. Power supplies convert AC input to DC output
b. You must make sure that the voltage selector switch on the back of the power supply is switched to the lower setting if the computer is going to be used in Europe
c. Power supplies supply power to ATX-based motherboards with connectors known commonly as P8 and P9
d. SATA hard drives most often use the same type of power connector that PATA hard drives use
correct_answer: a. Power supplies convert AC input to DC output
explanation: PC power supplies accept alternating current (AC) as input and produce direct current (DC) for the internal components. Europe requires the voltage selector switch be set at the higher setting. SATA drives most often use a specific power connector that is not compatible with the Molex connector used by PATA drives. Legacy AT-based motherboards called for P8 and P9 connectors; ATX motherboards have a newer 20- or 24-pin single power connector.

question: A client is looking for desktop drive technology that saves money over SSDs, offers performance increases over HDDs, and can be used to house the operating system. Which of the following is the best to recommend?
explanation: A solid-state hybrid drive incorporates the features of both conventional magnetic-only hard drives and solid-state drives. As a result, the performance of an SSHD exceeds that of a hard drive but costs less than the equivalent-sized SSD. A dual-drive option still requires the purchase of a full-sized SSD. Adding the cost of the SSD and the HDD, the dual-drive solution does not satisfy the requirement of an affordable technology. NVMe is a form of solid-state drive and does not save money.

question: What are the output voltages which have been commonly produced, by PC power supplies, over the years? (Please select five.)
explanation: A PC's power supply produces +3.3VDC, +5VDC, −5VDC, +12VDC, and -12VDC from a 240VAC input.

question: You are choosing an optical-drive format for a client. Which optical disc format supports a data capacity of 25 GB?
explanation: Blu-ray discs have a single-sided, single-layer capacity of 25 GB. A double-sided, single layer DVD can store about 9.4 GB, and a double-sided, double-layer DVD can store about 17.1 GB.

question: Which of the following best describes the concept of hot-swappable devices?
options: a. The device can be swapped while still hot, immediately after powering down the system
b. The device can be removed with power applied after it is properly stopped in the operating system
c. Care must be taken when swapping the device because it can be hot to the touch
d. Power does not need to be turned off before the device is inserted or removed
correct_answer: d. Power does not need to be turned off before the device is inserted or removed
explanation: Hot-swappable devices can be removed while the power to the system is still on. Warm-swappable devices need to be stopped in the operating system before being removed. The term has nothing to do with the heat level of the device.

question: You have been asked to install a new hard drive for a client. Which of the following is not a consideration when installing an internal storage device?
options: a. You need to be sure that the routing of the drive's data cable, if applicable, does not obstruct the engineered flow of air across internal components
b. You should match the form factor of the drive or adapt it to an available drive bay or slot
c. You should secure the drive with at least two screws on one side and preferably two on each side
d. Due to the high revolutions at which modern hard drives spin, you must secure an external power source because the internal power supplies do not have the capacity
correct_answer: d. Due to the high revolutions at which modern hard drives spin, you must secure an external power source because the internal power supplies do not have the capacity
explanation: Today's hard drives, regardless of their rpm, have standard internal power connections. The other options are valid concerns when installing an internal drive.

question: Due to government regulations, a client wants to preserve data for a long period of time. What kind of media is most commonly used when large amounts of data need to be archived on a regular basis?
explanation: Although inefficient as an interactive medium, sequential tape-based storage continues to be developed in increasing capacities. Tape continues to be a good choice for frequently backing up large amounts of data for redundancy and archival purposes. Optical discs don't have the same capacity, and neither do external hard drives. The cloud could be an option, but that is different from a network share.

question: Which of the following connector types is typically not associated with hard drive use?
explanation: DB-9 connectors are most often used with serial cables and are not associated with hard drives. USB-C, eSATA, and SCSI are examples of connectors used with hard drives.

question: A user with an iPhone 7 needs to charge her device and asks you to bring a cable. Which of the following connector-types should you ensure that the cable has?
explanation: Starting with the iPhone 5, Apple products use the proprietary Lightning connector for charging and connecting peripherals. Thunderbolt connectors are on MacBooks for peripherals. iPhones do not have built-in USB connectors.

question: Which type of pointing device features a ball and buttons on the top, and a flat, steady surface on the bottom?
explanation: A trackball is a sort of stationary upside-down mouse that has the ball for movement detection on the top of the device along with the keys. The ball is actuated by the thumb or fingers, not by moving the device along a flat surface or mouse pad. Trackballs are ideal where desk space is limited. Touch pads feature a touch-sensing surface with no ball for movement, while track pad is a more rare term meaning the same.

question: You are installing a replacement monitor on a desktop computer. Which of the following is true, regarding a monitor's refresh rate?
options: a. As you lower the resolution, the maximum refresh rate allowed tends to increase
b. The refresh rate is normally selected by using the controls on the front panel of the monitor
c. As long as the graphics adapter can refresh the image at a particular rate, the attached monitor can accommodate that refresh rate
d. The refresh rate is normally expressed in MHz
correct_answer: a. As you lower the resolution, the maximum refresh rate allowed tends to increase
explanation: As you lower the resolution, the maximum refresh rate allowed tends to increase. The refresh rate is most often expressed in cycles per second (Hz), not millions of cycles per second (MHz). You must usually select the refresh rate that you want from the display settings dialogs, not through the monitor's built-in menu system, although the monitor can often tell you the refresh rate that you're using. Finally, both the monitor and adapter must agree on the refresh rate you select. If either device does not support a particular refresh rate, such a rate cannot be used.

question: Which of the following are common methods for backlighting an LCD monitor? (Please select two.)
explanation: Light Emitting Diodes and Fluorescent bulbs are commonly found in laptop to and other LCD screen devices displays, and very old legacy devices may have even used Plasma.

question: Which kind of peripheral is used to read credit cards to initiate financial transactions? (Please select all that apply.)
explanation: Magnetic readers and chip readers can read credit and debit card information to initiate a financial transaction. Barcode readers read barcodes on packages. Signature pads allow for the digital input of someone's signature.

question: Which of the following display interfaces is equivalent to DisplayPort with PCIe added in?
explanation: Intel and Apple collaborated on Thunderbolt to add PCIe to VESA's DisplayPort and to make the resulting interface smaller and less expensive to connect. HDMI, DVI, and VGA are not equivalent to DisplayPort with PCIe added in.

question: What is the single, fixed resolution of an LCD called?
explanation: An LCD's native resolution is the single, fixed resolution that provides optimal clarity. There is no default or burned-in resolution. The refresh rate is how quickly the image is re-drawn on the screen, and the aspect ratio is the ratio of the resolution.

question: When purchasing a projector, which of the following is the most important characteristic to consider?
explanation: When evaluating a projector, understand how many lumens it produces. You need to ensure that it will be bright enough for the environment in which it will be used. Most projectors can support multiple aspect ratios and resolutions.

question: Why might you use a KVM switch?
options: a. You need to be able to switch the voltage supplied to a particular device
b. You have more than one server and don't want to buy certain external peripherals separately for each
c. You have multiple Ethernet devices that need to communicate with one another
d. You have a printer that is not attached to the network but you want multiple computers to be able to print to it
correct_answer: b. You have more than one server and don't want to buy certain external peripherals separately for each
explanation: KVM switches are ideal when you have multiple computers situated near one another and do not want to commit the extra desk space to each computer having its own keyboard, mouse, and monitor. KVMs are not designed for Ethernet devices or printers, and do not switch voltage.

question: Which of the following connector-types are capable of conducting power and transmitting data? (Please select all that apply.)
explanation: USB cables and eSATA cables can transmit power and data. You will find Lightning, USB-C, and micro-USB connectors on the ends of USB cables. A Molex connector is power-only. A DB-9 is for serial cables and is data-only.

question: How do you connect a DVI-A interface, on a peripheral, to a DVI-D interface on a computer?
options: a. With a standard DVI cable
c. You wouldn't interconnect those two interfaces
d. With a cable that is terminated on one end with a DVI-A connector and on the other end with a DVD-D connector
correct_answer: c. You wouldn't interconnect those two interfaces
explanation: Such a connection should not be made. DVI-I cables act like universal cables; they can connect two DVI-A interfaces or two DVI-D interfaces with adapters. Natively, they are used to connect two DVI-I interfaces, both of which are configured as either analog or digital. They are unable to convert the analog signal to a digital one, however. Analog and digital DVI interfaces are too disparate to interconnect.

question: You are installing peripherals on a new computer. Which of the following devices provides both input and output?
explanation: A touch screen provides video output, and users can touch the screen to provide input as well. A webcam is for video input, and a projector is for video output. A KVM switch lets users connect one keyboard, video, and mouse set to multiple computers and switch between them.

question: You want to enhance your display capabilities. Which of the following is possible to achieve with multi-monitor settings?
options: a. Cause two different desktops to merge onto the same monitor
b. Connect multiple monitors to your computer, by using a graphics adapter with two video interfaces
c. Connect two laptops together so they display the same desktop
d. Display different parts of your desktop on different monitors
correct_answer: b. Connect multiple monitors to your computer, by using a graphics adapter with two video interfaces
d. Display different parts of your desktop on different monitors
explanation: A graphics adapter card with two outputs gives you the ability to connect two monitors to your PC and either replicate both monitors or display different parts of your desktop, (extend) across two screens.

question: You are attaching an external hard drive to a computer with USB 2.0 ports. The user is concerned about data transfer speeds. What is the maximum speed of USB 2.0?
explanation: USB 2.0 has a maximum speed of 480 Mbps. USB 3.0 is 5 Gbps; USB 3.1 is 10 Gbps; and USB 3.2 is 20 Gbps.

question: VGA cables use which type of signal between the adapter and monitor?
explanation: VGA signals are analog, uncompressed, component signals that carry all of the video information for all three components of the original RGB signal. VGA signals are not digital, composite, or compressed.

question: Which of the following is not an example of a connector for a standard peripheral input device?
explanation: Peripherals most often use USB today, but they can also use D-sub connectors (rarely), and audio devices such as microphones and speakers use 1/8" jacks. Molex connectors are power connectors for PATA hard drives and optical drives.

question: You are installing a new video-card that has an HDMI port. Which of the following is true about HDMI cables? (Please select all that apply.)
options: a. They can transmit analog or digital signals
b. They are not used to connect to projectors
c. They can transmit audio as well as video
d. They can use HDMI or mini-HDMI connectors
correct_answer: c. They can transmit audio as well as video
d. They can use HDMI or mini-HDMI connectors
explanation: HDMI cables transmit digital video and audio signals. They can be used to connect to projectors or monitors. HDMI cables can have standard HDMI connectors, mini-HDMI connectors, or micro-HDMI connectors.

question: Which of the following resolutions is an example of a 16:10 aspect ratio?
explanation: Dividing 16 by 10 produces a value of 1.6. Dividing the first number of a 16:10 resolution by the second number always results in 1.6. Therefore, the answer is 1920 × 1200. Resolutions with a 4:3 aspect ratio produce the value 1.33, while 5.4 resolutions such as 1280 x 1024 produce the value 1.25. 16:9 aspect ratios have a value of 1.78.

question: You are interested in purchasing a new monitor and notice the contrast ratio specification. What does that refer to?
options: a. A term that was used with LCDs but is not a valid specification for OLEDs
b. A feature that changes based on the resolution setting
c. The ratio of luminance between two adjacent pixels
d. The ratio of luminance between the darkest and lightest colours that can be displayed
correct_answer: d. The ratio of luminance between the darkest and lightest colours that can be displayed
explanation: Contrast ratio is a selling point for LCDs and is relevant for all monitor types, including OLEDs. Higher contrast ratios mean the monitor displays darker blacks and brighter whites. The measure of luminance between adjacent pixels is known as contrast, not contrast ratio. Contrast ratio is not dependent upon resolution.

question: Which voltage is applied to the paper, to transfer the toner to the paper, in an EP process laser printer?
explanation: Because the toner on the drum has a slight negative charge (-100VDC), it requires a positive charge to transfer it to the paper; + 600VDC is the voltage used in an EP process laser printer.

question: Which types of printers are referred to as 'page printers', because they receive their print job instructions one page at a time? (Please select two.)
explanation: A page printer is a type of computer printer that prints a page at a time. Common types of page printers are the laser printer and the inkjet printer.

question: Which of the following is not an advantage of a Universal Serial Bus (USB) printer interface?
options: a. It automatically recognises new devices
b. It has a higher transfer rate than a serial connection
c. It allows the printer to communicate with networks, servers, and workstations
d. It has a higher transfer rate than a parallel connection
correct_answer: c. It allows the printer to communicate with networks, servers, and workstations
explanation: The rate of transfer and the ability to recognise new devices automatically are two of the major advantages that currently make USB the most popular type of printer interface. However, it is the network printer interface that allows the printer to communicate with networks, servers, and workstations.

question: Which type of printers can be used with multipart forms?
explanation: Dot-matrix printers are impact printers and therefore can be used with multipart forms. Daisy-wheel printers can be used with multipart forms as well.

question: Which step, in the EP imaging process, uses a laser to discharge selected areas of the photosensitive drum, thus forming an image on the drum?
explanation: The exposing step uses a laser to discharge selected areas of the photosensitive drum, thus forming an image on the drum.

question: Which of the following is fed through an extruder, on a 3D printer, to create objects?
explanation: 3D printers use filament to create objects. Filament is often plastic, but it can contain metals too. There is no extrusion powder.

question: What voltage does the corona wire, or corona roller, hold?
explanation: For the toner (which has a charge of –600VDC) to be transferred from the print drum (which has a charge of -600VDC) to the paper, there must be a positive, or opposite, charge of greater difference to break the –600VDC charge from the drum.

question: Which device, in an inkjet printer, contains the print head?
explanation: In an inkjet printer, the ink cartridge is the actual print head. This is where the ink is expelled to form letters or graphics. Toner cartridges are used by laser printers to store toner. A daisy wheel is the device that impacts the letters on the paper in a daisy-wheel printer. Paper trays are the storage bins in laser printers and inkjet printers that allow the pickup rollers to feed the paper into the printer.

question: What is the correct order of steps in the EP imaging process?
options: a. Charging, processing, exposing, developing, transferring, fusing, cleaning
b. Developing, exposing, transferring, fusing, charging, cleaning, processing
c. Processing, charging, exposing, developing, transferring, fusing, cleaning
d. Processing, transferring, exposing, developing, charging, cleaning, fusing
correct_answer: c. Processing, charging, exposing, developing, transferring, fusing, cleaning
explanation: The correct sequence in the EP imaging process is processing, charging, exposing, developing, transferring, fusing, and cleaning.

question: What is typically included in the EP laser printer toner cartridge? (Please select three.)
explanation: An electrophotographic (EP) laser printer toner cartridge includes the toner, print drum, and cleaning blade. The laser is usually contained within the printer, not within the toner cartridge.

question: What happens during the developing stage of laser printing?
options: a. Heat is applied to the paper to melt the toner
b. An electrostatic charge is applied to the paper to attract toner particles
c. An electrostatic charge is applied to the drum to attract toner particles
d. The laser creates an image of the page on the drum
correct_answer: c. An electrostatic charge is applied to the drum to attract toner particles
explanation: After a laser has created an image of the page, the developing roller uses a magnet and electrostatic charges to attract toner to itself and then transfers the toner to the areas on the drum that have been exposed to the laser. The toner is melted during the fusing stage. The laser creates an image of the page on the drum in the exposing stage. An electrostatic charge is applied to the paper to attract toner in the transferring stage, which happens immediately after the developing stage.

question: Which of the following are possible interfaces for printers? (Please select three.)
explanation: Printers can communicate via parallel, serial, USB, wireless, and network connections.

question: You have just installed a new printer, but it prints only garbled text. Which of the following is likely to be the problem?
explanation: If a printer is using out-of-date or incorrect printer drivers, the printer may produce pages of garbled text. The solution is to ensure that the most recent printer drivers are downloaded from the manufacturer's website.

question: Which printer contains a wheel that looks like a flower, with raised letters and symbols on each 'petal'?
explanation: The daisy-wheel printer gets its name because it contains a wheel with raised letters and symbols on each 'petal'.

question: What part of a laser printer supplies the voltages for charging and transferring corona assemblies?
explanation: The high-voltage power supply (HVPS) is the part of the laser printer that supplies the voltages for charging and transferring corona assemblies.

question: Which printer part transfers the toner from the photosensitive drum, onto the paper?
explanation: The transfer corona assembly gets the toner from the photosensitive drum onto the paper. For some printers, this is a transfer corona wire; for other printers, it is a transfer corona roller.

question: Which step, in the laser printer printing process, occurs immediately after the exposing phase?
explanation: Developing happens after exposing. The correct order is processing, charging, exposing, developing, transferring, fusing, and cleaning.

question: Which laser printer component permanently presses the toner into the paper?
explanation: The fuser assembly presses and melts the toner into the paper. The transfer corona transfers the toner from the drum to the paper. The printer controller circuitry converts signals from the PC into signals for the various printer assemblies. The paper transport assembly controls the movement of the paper through the printer.

question: Which of the following most accurately describes how to obtain a firmware upgrade for your laser printer?
options: a. Contact the manufacturer of the printer, and they will send you the firmware upgrade on a DVD
b. Download the firmware upgrade for free from the manufacturer's website
c. Have a certified laser printer technician come to your site and install a new firmware chip
d. Pay to download the firmware upgrade from the manufacturer's website
correct_answer: b. Download the firmware upgrade for free from the manufacturer's website
explanation: Firmware upgrades for laser printers are downloaded for free from the manufacturer's website. A technician does not need to install a new chip, because firmware is upgraded via software. It's unlikely that the manufacturer will send you the upgrade on a DVD; it will refer you to its website to download it.

question: What level of QoS is designated for interactive voice and video?
explanation: QoS level 5 is designated for interactive voice and video, with less than 100 ms delay. Level 1 is for background applications and is low priority. Level 4 is known as controlled load, which is lower priority than interactive voice and video. Level 6 only has 10 ms latency but is reserved for control traffic.

question: Which of the following are features that allow 802.11ac to achieve higher data throughput? (Please select two.)
explanation: The two technologies that 802.11ac employs to achieve high throughput are channel bonding and MIMO. Channel bonding is the combination of multiple smaller channels into one large channel for greater bandwidth. MIMO is enhanced over 802.11n to allow for more multiple inputs and outputs. 802.11ac also uses beamforming, but that helps the range, not the throughput.

question: Which of the following broadband technologies provide two dedicated, digital data channels which can be combined for greater throughput?
explanation: Basic rate interface ISDN (BRI ISDN) provides two separate 64 Kbps B channels for data transmissions. These channels can be combined to increase throughput. A PRI ISDN uses 23 B channels. DSL, cable, and satellite do not offer multiple dedicated digital channels.

question: You have set up a wireless router on your network and configured it to use AES. Which configuration option do you need to choose on the client computers?
explanation: If your router is using AES, the clients will need to use WPA2. TKIP is a protocol utilised by WPA. WEP is the weakest of the encryption options.

question: You have just installed a wireless router on your home network. Which of the following should you do to make it highly secure? (Please select all that apply.)
options: d. Change the default administrator name and password
correct_answer: d. Change the default administrator name and password
explanation: You should always change the default administrator name and password as well as the default SSID when installing a new wireless router. Enabling encryption is also a good idea, but WPA and WPA2 are better options than WEP. The channel has nothing to do with security.

question: Which service allows users, with private IP addresses, to access the Internet using a public IP address?
explanation: Network Address Translation (NAT) allows users to have a private IP address and still access the Internet with a public IP address. NAT is installed on a router and translates the private IP address into a public address for the user to access the Internet. DHCP assigns IP configuration information to clients. DNS resolves hostnames to IP addresses. A DMZ is an area on a network between an external router and an internal router.

question: What is the most secure wireless encryption standard for 802.11 networks?
explanation: WEP was the original encryption standard developed for Wi-Fi networks, but it is easily hacked. WPA is an upgrade, but WPA2 is more secure and incorporates the entire 802.11i standard. SAFER+ is used to encrypt Bluetooth communications.

question: Besides 802.11 standards, which wireless communication methods work in the 2.4 GHz range? (Please select all that apply.)
explanation: Bluetooth and Zigbee also operate in the 2.4 GHz range. Z-Wave operates in the 800 MHz and 900 MHz ranges; satellite uses satellite waves; 5 G cellular mmWave is between 24 GHz and 86 GHz; and NFC uses 13.56 MHz.

question: Which of the following security standards was the first to introduce a dynamic, 128-bit per-packet security key?
explanation: WEP could use a 64-bit or 128-bit security key, but it was a static key. TKIP introduced a dynamic per-packet key. AES and CCMP came after TKIP.

question: Which of the following are advantages to using dial-up Internet service? (Please select two.)
explanation: Dial-up Internet is archaic by today's standards, but it is widely available (anywhere there is phone service), and it's generally lower in cost than other Internet access methods. It's definitely not high speed, and its security is really no different from that of broadband Internet access methods.

question: You are setting up a small office network for a client. Which Internet service would you recommend to provide the best speed?
explanation: Of the options listed, DSL provides the fastest speed. DSL can easily provide 12 Mbps downloads. Dial-up is limited to 56 Kbps, and BRI ISDN (128 Kbps) and PRI (about 1.5 Mbps) don't even come close. Satellite is also much slower than DSL.

question: You are installing a single, 802.11g wireless network. The office space is large enough that you need three WAPs. Which channels should you configure the WAPs on to avoid communication issues?
explanation: There are 14 communication channels in the 2.4 GHz range, but only the first 11 are configurable. The three non-overlapping channels are 1, 6, and 11.

question: You are setting up a wireless network. Which wireless standards would give the users over 40 Mbps throughput? (Please select all that apply.)
explanation: Three standards listed—802.11ac (1,300 Mbps), 802.11g (54Mbps), and 802.11n (600 Mbps)—give users the required throughput.

question: What is the primary function of the SSID?
options: a. To serve as a type of password used to secure a wireless connection
b. To secure communication between a server and a remote host
c. To serve as a parameter used to identify a network and configure a wireless connection
d. To secure communication between a web server and a browser
correct_answer: c. To serve as a parameter used to identify a network and configure a wireless connection
explanation: A service-set identifier (SSID) is the unique name given to the wireless network. All hardware that is to participate on the network must be configured to use the same SSID. Essentially, it is the network name. When you are using Windows to connect to a wireless network, all available wireless networks will be listed by their SSID.

question: Which of the following wireless IEEE standards. operate on the 2.4 GHz radio frequency and are directly compatible with each other? (Please select two.)
explanation: Both 802.11b and 802.11 g operate in the 2.4 GHz range and use similar transmission standards. Many devices on the market are listed as 802.11b/g, meaning they will work with either system. Alternatively, 802.11a and 802.11ac operate in the 5 GHz range.

question: You have been asked to configure a network for a small office. The wireless router is installed, and now you need to connect the client computers. What do you enter,on the client computers, to connect to the router?
explanation: To join the network, client computers need to find the SSID, ensure that the security settings are correct (to match the router), and enter the security passphrase. As an administrator, you should have configured this passphrase to be different from the router's administrator password.

question: Which of the following technologies can operate in the 125 kHz to 134 kHz range?
explanation: Radio frequency identification (RFID) can operate in three frequency bands: 125 kHz to 134 kHz, 13.56 MHz, or 856 MHz to 960 MHz. Bluetooth is 2.4 GHz; NFC is 13.56 MHz; and LTE is between 600 MHz and 6 GHz.

question: You are running an 802.11g wireless router in mixed mode. You have three 802.11 g wireless NICs using the router. A new user connects using an 802.11b wireless NIC. What will happen?
options: a. The user with 802.11b will access the network at 11 Mbps, and the users with 802.11 g will access the network at 54 Mbps (unless they are communicating with the 802.11b device, which will be at 11 Mbps)
b. All users will access the network at 11 Mbps
c. The user with 802.11b will access the network at 11 Mbps, while the users with 802.11 g will access the network at 54 Mbps
d. The user with 802.11b will not be able to communicate on the network
correct_answer: b. All users will access the network at 11 Mbps
explanation: The good news is that 802.11 g is backward compatible with 802.11b. The bad news is, if you run in a mixed environment, all devices that communicate with the WAP (or router) will be forced to slow down to accommodate the older technology.

question: A firewall operates using a set of rules known as what?
explanation: The set of rules for access on a firewall is called an access control list (ACL). An SLA is an agreement on service level for QoS. A whitelist may be part of an ACL but is not the set of rules. A DMZ is a subnet located between an external network router and an internal router.

question: When enabled, which feature of a wireless router allows only specified computers to access the network?
explanation: MAC filtering is a security option that can specify that only computers with specific MAC (hardware) addresses can access the network. Port forwarding is a feature of firewalls. WPS is an easy setup mechanism for wireless networks. SSID is the wireless network name.

question: Which type of coaxial cable is recommended for digital television cable signals?
