Shut down the system immediately and investigate the problem. Grinding or clicking noises generally indicate a mechanical problem with the hard drive disk (HDD), not overheating problems. LED status lights can indicate if the computer is getting power or other diagnostic codes. They do not indicate overheating. A blank screen can indicate anything from no power to a faulty screen. A blank screen does not directly point to overheating problems.

question: A user is trying to mirror a computer to a large display monitor for a presentation. The computer is on, and the display reads "no input" on the screen. An HDMI cable connects the two devices. What would be the next thing to check?
explanation: The computer and the monitor display are on, and a cable connects the two. The next thing to check is to ensure the user chooses the appropriate data source. Generally, a menu on the display will change the data source to the appropriate high-definition multimedia interface (HDMI) cable. The monitor display is already on, indicated by the "no input" on the screen. The HDMI cable may be the problem, but the more obvious problem is that the user chose the wrong input source on the display screen. A burned-out bulb is a problem with a light-emitting diode (LED) projector, not a large monitor display.

question: A user complains that their laptop does not hold a charge for more than 30 minutes, even after charging all night. They also mention that there is an error message when they restart their computer that states something about power. What is likely the problem?
explanation: AC adapters can get mixed up. If an under-powered adapter is used, the laptop will display a warning at boot. Using the wrong adapter can cause problems, such as the battery not completely charging. As batteries age, they no longer hold a charge and need to be replaced. This would be the best answer, except that the boot error points to another problem. A swollen battery indicates a problem with the battery's charging circuit. This can be diagnosed by the keyboard or trackpad being pushed up or the laptop wobbling when sitting on a flat surface. Charging ports can be damaged by improper insertion and removal of the connectors. Signs of this are no charging or intermittent charging.

question: A technician is working on a blank computer monitor problem. The monitor power cord is plugged in and receiving power. What is the next step to check?
options: Check if the monitor connects to the computer.
correct_answer: Check if the monitor connects to the computer.
explanation: A systematic approach to troubleshooting helps save time and effort. After verifying that the monitor is getting power, checking that the monitor connects to the computer is the next logical step. The power supply unit (PSU) is a component on the computer that can cause intermittent issues if it is failing. There is no indication that the PSU is the problem here. Incorrect monitor input settings can cause a blank screen but the technician should follow the step verifying that the monitor connects to the computer first. Physical damage to a computer can cause problems, but there is no indication that this could be the problem and is not a logical next step.

question: What problem does a screensaver help prevent?
explanation: When the same static image displays for an extended period, it can damage the monitor's picture elements, causing a ghost image to "burn" permanently onto the display. An animated screensaver can help prevent this problem. If the output resolution does not match the display device's native resolution, then the image will appear fuzzy. Incorrect settings or a failed backlight can cause a dim image. Adjusting the brightness and contrast of a display can help fix a dim image. A flat-panel monitor defect may cause individual pixels to be "stuck" or "dead." If a digital display panel has stuck pixels and the panel is not replaceable under warranty, then software utilities are available to reactivate pixels.

question: A computer monitor keeps flickering. The technician has checked the connectors and replaced the cords, yet the problem continues. The technician connects the display to another computer, and the flickering problem is gone. What is the likely problem?
explanation: A faulty or overheating video card could cause a flickering screen. Attaching the display device to a different computer isolates the cause of the issue. Since the flickering stopped when connected to a different computer, the display is not the problem. If the display were failing, it would also likely include bright or dim bands or lines and bright spots at the edge of the screen. An incorrect resolution will cause a blurry image but not a flickering image. Incorrect contrast controls can cause a dim image but not a flickering image.

question: A RAID array cannot boot, and the technician cannot reach the configuration utility. There have been no recent changes to the array. What is the likely problem?
explanation: If the redundant array of independent disks (RAID) array cannot boot, the first step is to use the configuration utility to verify the status. If the system cannot reach it, then the controller likely failed. Single disk failure would not stop the booting process from happening. RAID arrays operate so that a single disk can fail and not cause any data loss. Misconfiguration can always be a problem, but no recent changes occurred in this case. If it was booting fine before and no configurations have changed, then misconfiguration is highly unlikely to be the problem. A failed real-time clock (RTC) battery will cause an incorrect date or time but will not stop a RAID array from booting.

question: A computer is not displaying any content on the screen, and it makes continuous beeps after booting. What is the likely problem?
explanation: Not all modern computers use power-on self-test (POST) beep codes, but it is a valuable diagnostic tool. For example, the continuous beep code indicates a problem with system memory modules or memory controllers. This problem can stop the computer from booting or from displaying properly. The system will indicate a keyboard issue with three long beeps, and the technician can generally solve it by removing whatever is depressing a key. A faulty screen would result in a blank screen, but it does not give the POST beep code. A power supply error results in either repeating short beeps or the computer failing to initiate POST at all.

question: A user brings in a smartphone for repair. The device is unable to send or receive calls, or connect to WiFi. All applications on the device are working, unless they require connectivity. Which of the following is most likely to have caused the problem?
explanation: Airplane mode disables all wireless communications on a device, including cellular, WiFi, and Bluetooth, which matches the symptoms described.

question: An analyst asks a technician to recommend a solution for a customer, in the software development industry, to minimise the investment in hardware. Which of the following solutions should the technician recommend to best meet the customer’s requirement?
options: Purchase a number of low-cost devices, installing the required OSs and applications on each one, and use separate machines for each testing environment.
Purchase a high-end system meeting the hardware requirements for all of the individual OSs and applications, then configure a VM for each testing environment.
Purchase one computer and create images for each computer configuration and OS, then re-image the machine for each testing environment.
Purchase a number of computers, installing a VM on each one, then configure each VM with an OS for the testing environment.
correct_answer: Purchase a high-end system meeting the hardware requirements for all of the individual OSs and applications, then configure a VM for each testing environment.
explanation: Using virtual machines (VMs) on a single, powerful high-end system is the most cost-effective solution. It minimizes hardware investment while allowing for multiple, isolated testing environments to run simultaneously.

question: A user logs on to a PC and receives a message stating there is a duplicate IP address on the network. After a system restart, the user notices the same error. Which of the following is the most probable cause of the error?
options: The user has wireless and wired connections.
The user has moved to a different office.
The user has set a static IP address.
The user is still logged into another device.
correct_answer: The user has set a static IP address.
explanation: A duplicate IP address error occurs when two devices on the same network have the same IP address. If a user has manually set a static IP address that is already in use by another device or is within the DHCP server's assignment pool, this conflict will arise persistently, even after a restart.

question: Several computers are having network connectivity issues. Two computers are wired and are not having any issues. The technician verifies that none of the computers having issues have been assigned a static IP. Which of the following should the technician check next?
options: Check the closest AP for the area.
explanation: Since multiple devices are affected and are not using static IPs, they rely on a DHCP server for their IP addresses. If the DHCP server is down or has run out of available IP addresses to assign, new devices will be unable to connect to the network.

question: Which of the following charging and data ports has a non-directional connector?
explanation: The USB-C connector is reversible, meaning it can be plugged in upside down without issue. All the other listed USB types have a specific orientation and can only be inserted one way.

question: The touch-screen feature on a Windows device has stopped working. Which of the following should a technician check first?
explanation: The digitizer is the component of a touch screen that converts touch input into digital signals. The settings for the digitizer, often found within the Control Panel or Windows Settings, control its calibration and function. This is the most direct place to start troubleshooting a non-functional touch screen.

question: A user is no longer able to browse the Internet after returning from vacation. The user is able to log in and navigate to the local intranet, but not to any external sites. A technician pings a well-known website by name, but gets no reply. The technician then pings its IP address and gets a reply. Which of the following commands is most likely to resolve the issue?
explanation: The ability to ping an IP address but not its domain name points to a DNS (Domain Name System) resolution problem. The ipconfig /flushdns command clears the local DNS cache, which may contain outdated or corrupt information, forcing the computer to re-query the DNS server.

question: A technician has noticed that when at company headquarters, the laptop connection to the Internet is more responsive than when using a company-provided phone as a hotspot. The technician updated the drivers on the WiFi NIC, without resolution, and then verified that the configuration on the WiFi was correct. Which of the following configurations could cause the decreased performance?
options: There is a low RFID signal.
explanation: Mobile carriers often throttle, or intentionally slow down, data speeds on hotspot plans after a certain amount of data has been used. This is a common cause for slower performance on a phone's hotspot compared to a dedicated office network.

question: A user is having a problem with printing a specific type of document. The network printer OCP shows that the printer is online with no errors, and other users are not having this issue. The user sends the document to another printer and the document prints. Which of the following should a technician do first when troubleshooting the problem?
options: Have each user send the same document to the correct printer queue.
Verify the user is sending the document to the correct printer queue.
Stop and restart the print server queues, and then have the user resend the document.
Stop and restart the PC print spooler service.
correct_answer: Verify the user is sending the document to the correct printer queue.
explanation: Before exploring more complex solutions, the simplest and most common cause should be checked first. It's highly possible the user is accidentally selecting the wrong printer from the print dialog box.

question: Which of the following resources is the MOST critical when using cloud file-storage synchronization applications?
explanation: Cloud synchronization applications constantly upload and download files between the local device and the cloud. This process is heavily dependent on the available network bandwidth (Input/Output bandwidth) to transfer data quickly and efficiently. Insufficient bandwidth is the most common bottleneck for these applications.

question: A second SATA (Serial Advanced Technology Attachment) hard drive was installed on your workstation. After connecting the data and power connections to the hard drive, which other setting must be configured to ensure access to the hard drive?
options: Enable the additional SATA power port on the motherboard.
Enable the additional SATA data port on the motherboard.
Ensure the SATA port is enabled from within the BIOS.
correct_answer: Ensure the SATA port is enabled from within the BIOS.
explanation: Modern motherboards often allow individual SATA ports to be enabled or disabled in the BIOS/UEFI. If a newly installed drive isn't detected, you must first ensure the specific port it's connected to is activated in the system's BIOS/UEFI settings.

question: A technician is setting up a new wireless network at a branch office which previously had only wired connectivity with statically assigned IP addresses. After setting up the network, the technician configures a server to provide IP addresses to wireless clients. During testing, the technician is unable to access the Internet or named network resources. The technician receives a valid IP address from the DHCP server and can ping the default gateway. Which of the following should the technician check next to resolve this issue?
options: Enable file and printer sharing in the OS.
Ensure the options are configured to provide a DNS server.
Verify that the Windows Firewall is turned off.
Configure the wireless network’s SSID to be hidden.
correct_answer: Ensure the options are configured to provide a DNS server.
explanation: The symptoms described (getting a valid IP, pinging the gateway, but failing to access named resources like websites) strongly indicate a DNS (Domain Name System) resolution failure. The DHCP server is responsible for providing clients with an IP address, subnet mask, default gateway, and DNS server addresses. The technician needs to verify the DHCP server is correctly configured to hand out a valid DNS server address.

question: A technician is determining the specifications for a desktop computer which will be used at trade shows globally. The computer will have the maximum amount of RAM. The CPU, GPU, and storage will be typical of a business workstation. Which of the following system parameters is most important for the technician to consider when choosing a power input voltage?
explanation:
For a computer used globally, two power supply features are critical:
Switchable Voltage Control: Different countries use different standard wall voltages (e.g., ~115V in North America, ~230V in Europe). A power supply with switchable voltage (or an auto-switching capability) is essential to ensure it can work safely in different regions.
Efficiency rating: A higher efficiency rating (e.g., 80 Plus Bronze, Gold) means the power supply wastes less energy as heat. This is important for reliability and can lead to lower running costs, especially for a machine that may be running for long periods at trade shows.

question: A printer stops working in the billing department and cannot be repaired. A new printer has been ordered and a technician is tasked with allowing other users to print to the billing manager’s printer until the new printer arrives. The manager’s printer is currently used via USB connection, and there are no network jacks available for use. What should the technician do to remedy this?
options: Install the printer on the users’ desktops and point it to the IP address of the manager’s computer.
Create a Printer Share on the manager’s computer and give the users rights to the share.
Provide flash drives to the users so they can transfer data to the manager’s computer for printing.
Purchase a wireless printer so the users can access the printer via the network.
correct_answer: Create a Printer Share on the manager’s computer and give the users rights to the share.
explanation: Since the printer is connected via USB to the manager's computer, the most direct and efficient solution is to use the operating system's built-in printer sharing feature. This turns the manager's computer into a print server for that specific printer, allowing other users on the same network to send print jobs to it.

question: When configuring Microsoft Hyper-V as a hypervisor, three types of virtual switches can be created. Which type is only used by the virtual machine and host?
explanation:
In Hyper-V:
An External switch binds to a physical network adapter, allowing VMs to access the physical network.
An Internal switch creates a network that can be used by the VMs and the host machine, but it is not connected to the physical network.
A Private switch creates a network that can only be used by the VMs on that host; the host machine itself cannot communicate on this network.
Therefore, the Internal switch is the correct choice for communication between VMs and the host only.

question: A user is experiencing email problems and explains to a technician that all emails with graphics or images do not display the graphics. Which of the following configurations would correct this behavior?
options: Change the security settings of the email client.
Change the email settings in antivirus.
correct_answer: Change the security settings of the email client.
explanation: Most modern email clients (like Outlook or Thunderbird) have built-in security features that block externally linked images by default to protect user privacy and prevent tracking. To display the images, the user typically needs to adjust a setting within the email client's trust or security options to allow the automatic downloading of pictures.

question: Users are complaining that a shared printer is no longer printing. You decide to manually delete the print spool data on the Windows computer. Which step do you need to perform first?
explanation: The Print Spooler service manages the print queue and the files associated with it. You cannot manually delete these files while the service is running because the files will be locked by the service. The correct procedure is to first stop the service, then delete the stuck files from the spool folder, and finally restart the service.

question: A user reports their workstation is continuously rebooting. After arriving at the user's desk, you have identified the problem relating to recently-installed GPUs (Graphics Processing Units). What do you do next?
options: You establish a plan of action to resolve the problem and implement the solution.
You test your theory and reseat the GPU.
You establish a theory of probable cause.
correct_answer: You establish a theory of probable cause.
explanation: This question follows the standard troubleshooting methodology. After identifying the problem (Step 1), the next logical step (Step 2) is to establish a theory of probable cause. Your theory could be "the new GPU is drawing too much power for the PSU," "the GPU driver is unstable," or "the GPU is not seated correctly." Only after forming a theory do you move on to testing it.

question: A user wants to print a large job on both the front and back sides of the paper. Which of the following should the technician advise the user to change in the printer settings?
explanation: Duplex printing is the technical term for printing on both sides of a sheet of paper. This option can be found in the printer properties or preferences dialog box before sending a document to print.

question: In a virtual environment, which of the following allows all the VMs to have RAM allocated for use?
explanation: Resource pooling is a core concept in virtualization and cloud computing. It refers to the practice of grouping the physical resources of the host server(s)—such as CPU, RAM, and storage—into a shared pool. The hypervisor can then dynamically allocate these resources from the pool to the various virtual machines as needed.

question: A technician is replacing a broken screen on a new company laptop but does not have repair information from the vendor. Which of the following is the best way to proceed?
options: Document and label the cable and screw locations.
Replace the screen with a non-OEM.
Wait for the vendor to provide more information.
Update the firmware on the device before repairing it.
correct_answer: Document and label the cable and screw locations.
explanation: When performing a repair without official instructions (a "teardown"), the most important step is to meticulously document everything. Taking photos and labeling where each screw and cable goes ensures that you can reassemble the device correctly and avoid causing further damage.

question: A systems administrator is configuring a server to host several virtual machines. Once complete, the administrator is ready to begin provisioning the virtual machines. Which of the following features should the administrator utilise to complete the task?
explanation: The hypervisor (also known as a Virtual Machine Monitor or VMM) is the software, firmware, or hardware that creates and runs virtual machines (VMs). It's the fundamental platform a system administrator uses to provision, manage, and operate VMs.

question: Which of the following features, when disabled, will significantly save the battery life of a laptop? (Select TWO).
explanation: Radio transmitters are major power consumers on mobile devices. Both the Cellular and Bluetooth radios constantly scan for networks and connections, drawing a significant amount of power.  Disabling them when not in use is one of the most effective ways to extend battery life.

question: Which of the following peripherals would a company use to take inventory quickly, renew credit to a prepay card, or a personal user to quickly transfer funds? (Choose all that apply).
explanation:
Barcode scanner: Used for rapidly scanning items for inventory management. 
Magnetic reader: Used for swiping cards with magnetic stripes, such as credit or prepay cards. 
NFC device: Used for contactless "tap-to-pay" transactions and quick fund transfers between personal devices.

question: A technician is troubleshooting a laptop/projector combination that is displaying artifacts on the screen. When a different laptop is connected to the projector, the image appears to be correct but is very dim. Which of the following steps should the technician take to address these issues immediately? (Select TWO).
options: Update the video drivers on the laptop.
Change the aspect ratio on the projector.
Replace the bulb in the projector.
correct_answer: Update the video drivers on the laptop.
explanation:
There are two separate issues here:
Artifacts: Since the artifacts only appear with the first laptop, the issue lies with that specific device, not the projector. Outdated or corrupt video drivers are a common cause of display artifacts.
Dim Image: The dimness is an issue with the projector itself (likely a failing bulb). While replacing the bulb is the proper long-term fix, an immediate remedy is to go into the projector's settings and increase the contrast or brightness to make the image more visible temporarily.

question: A user’s laptop is shutting down unexpectedly. The technician discovers the shutdowns only happen when the laptop is moved from one room to another. The technician reseated the hard drive, memory, battery, and LCD cable, but the laptop continues to shut down. Which of the following is the most probable cause of the issue?
explanation: The key symptom is that the shutdown occurs with physical movement. This strongly suggests a physical component is momentarily losing contact. Since the battery itself has been reseated, the issue is likely with the connection point on the motherboard or the battery housing, which is causing power to be cut when the laptop is jostled.

question: You are installing an older scanner for a user. Which type of scanning acquisition software will likely be used?
explanation: TWAIN is a long-standing, cross-platform industry standard that allows imaging software (like Photoshop) to communicate directly with hardware like scanners. For an older scanner, TWAIN is the most likely driver and software interface it would use for compatibility.

question: A customer’s laptop display has suddenly become very dim. The image of the display can only be seen with a bright, external light, as adjusting the brightness/contrast controls does not have an effect. Which of the following components are most likely to need replacing?
explanation: This is the classic symptom of a failed backlight system in an older CCFL (Cold Cathode Fluorescent Lamp) display. The inverter is the component that takes low-voltage DC power from the motherboard and converts it into the high-voltage AC power needed to light up the backlight. When it fails, the screen's image is still being generated, but there's no light behind it to make it visible.

question: Which of the following cloud computing concepts allows scalable services to be provided to the client?
explanation: Rapid elasticity is the specific term for the cloud's ability to quickly and automatically scale resources (like processing power, storage, or bandwidth) up or down to meet demand. This is what allows services to handle sudden traffic spikes without manual intervention and scale back down to save costs when the demand subsides.

question: A technician is setting up a WiFi-enabled thermostat for a customer, but the customer is concerned about IoT devices getting hacked. Which of the following best address the customer’s concerns? (Select TWO).
options: Upgrade the customer’s wireless network encryption to WPA.
Enable two-factor authentication for the IoT device’s cloud account, if it is available.
Upgrade the customer’s router to the latest version to improve network security.
Disable wireless access on the thermostat to make it unshakable.
Use the latest encryption standard on the wireless network and set a strong password.
Separate the IoT thermostat by segregating it in a DMZ network.
correct_answer: Enable two-factor authentication for the IoT device’s cloud account, if it is available.
Separate the IoT thermostat by segregating it in a DMZ network.
explanation:
These two options provide the best security layers:
Enable two-factor authentication (2FA): Secures the online account used to manage the device, preventing unauthorized access even if the password is stolen. 
Separate the IoT thermostat... in a DMZ network: This is a powerful network security practice. By placing the IoT device on an isolated network segment (a DMZ or, more commonly for homes, a Guest Network), you prevent it from accessing your primary trusted devices (like computers and phones). If the thermostat gets hacked, the attacker cannot easily pivot to attack other devices on your main network.

question: A user reports hearing a clicking sound and received an error message when saving a file. Which actions should you take?
explanation: A clicking sound is a classic symptom of a mechanical hard drive failure. Before attempting any repairs or replacing the drive, the first step is to run a diagnostic check. S.M.A.R.T. (Self-Monitoring, Analysis, and Reporting Technology) is a monitoring system built into hard drives that can provide a status report on the drive's health and predict failures.

question: A technician is troubleshooting a Windows CAD workstation which is running slowly. The computer uses RAID 10 and has dual GPU cards. The user states that the same application runs faster on an identical workstation. Which of the following should the technician perform first to troubleshoot the problem?
options: Clear the RAID configuration file and restart the PC.
Check the event log for any issues.
Replace the RAID controller write cache module.
correct_answer: Check the event log for any issues.
explanation: When troubleshooting a general performance issue, the Windows Event Log is the best place to start. It records significant errors, warnings, and informational events from the operating system and applications. This log could contain crucial clues, such as a failing disk in the RAID 10 array or driver conflicts, which could be the source of the slowdown.

question: A technician is troubleshooting what appears to be a RAM issue on a PC. Which of the following symptoms indicate that this is a RAM issue?
explanation: Faulty RAM is a primary cause of system instability. When the operating system attempts to read from or write to a bad memory address, it can cause a fatal system error (like a Blue Screen of Death), forcing a restart. If the issue is persistent, this can result in a continuous reboot loop. While POST beeps can also indicate RAM problems at startup, unexpected reboots during operation are a very common symptom.

question: Ann, an accountant, reports that after turning on her new laptop, she received a message stating her IP address is already in use on the system. She tried going back to her old desktop, which she now only uses for email, but received the same message. The technician checks the account and sees a comment that Ann requires a special network setup to connect to the banking software. Which of the following should the technician do to resolve the issue?
options: Bridge the LAN connection between the laptop and the desktop.
Remove the static IP configuration from the desktop.
Set the laptop configuration to DHCP to prevent conflicts.
Replace the network card in the laptop, as it may be defective.
correct_answer: Remove the static IP configuration from the desktop.
explanation: The error indicates an IP address conflict. Since both the old and new computers are showing the error, and there's a note about a "special network setup," it's highly likely both machines were configured with the same static IP address. To resolve the conflict, the static IP address should be removed from the old desktop, freeing it up for the new laptop which needs it for the banking software.

question: What is the name of the feature that allows users to store files in the cloud when necessary, but remove them from local storage when space is needed?
explanation: Cloud storage services like OneDrive and Dropbox use a feature called "Files On-Demand" or "Smart Sync." This feature allows file placeholders to be shown on the local device without taking up space. The full file is only downloaded from the cloud when the user opens it. The system can then automatically clear locally cached files to save space, making them "online-only" again.

question: Your company is running Intel Core 2 Duo processors and wants to upgrade the motherboards. Which of the following factors will determine the type of motherboard you purchase?
options: A motherboard that supports 16 GB of DDR3 RAM
A motherboard with x16 PCIe expansion slots
A motherboard with a TPM 2.0 chip
A motherboard with an Intel chipset
correct_answer: A motherboard with an Intel chipset.
explanation: The most critical requirement for CPU and motherboard compatibility is the chipset and the CPU socket. An Intel Core 2 Duo processor requires a motherboard with a specific physical socket (LGA 775) and a compatible Intel chipset from that era (e.g., P45, G41, etc.). Motherboards with AMD chipsets, for example, would be physically and electronically incompatible.

question: Which of the following channels would commonly be used on an 802.11 wireless network?
explanation: In the 2.4 GHz WiFi band, there are multiple channels, but many of them overlap, causing interference. In North America, channels 1, 6, and 11 are the three channels that do not overlap with each other. It is a standard best practice to configure access points on one of these three channels to minimize interference and ensure the most stable connection.

question: Which of the following is not a technical component of the screen?
explanation: The display (LCD/OLED panel), inverter (on older screens), and digitizer (for touch input) are all functional, electronic components of a screen assembly. The bezel is the plastic or metal frame that surrounds the screen; it is a structural and cosmetic part, not a technical one.

question: Which of the following cable types should be used to connect a cable modem to a SOHO router?
explanation: A cable modem receives the internet signal from the provider via a coaxial cable. To share this connection with a local network, the modem's LAN port is connected to the router's WAN (or Internet) port using a standard Ethernet cable.

question: Ann, a user, needs to attend several day-long conferences and wants to ensure that her mobile device will have connectivity for important updates. She is concerned about wall outlet availability at the conferences and needs to continuously use her device. Which of the following should a technician recommend to best accommodate Ann’s needs?
explanation: Given the need for continuous use and the lack of guaranteed power outlets, a built-in battery case is the most practical solution. It combines a protective case with an external battery, effectively doubling the device's battery life without requiring separate cables or access to a power source during the day.

question: A network administrator must install a device that will proactively stop outside attacks from reaching the LAN. Which of the following devices would best meet the organisation’s needs?
explanation: An IPS (Intrusion Prevention System) is a proactive security device that monitors network traffic for malicious activity. When it detects a potential threat, it can automatically take action to block or "prevent" the attack from reaching the internal network. An IDS (Intrusion Detection System) can only detect and log threats but cannot stop them on its own.

question: A user is unable to read a disk from the Compact Disk (CD) drive. Which of the following actions can you take when troubleshooting the optical drive?
options: Ensure the proper codecs are installed.
explanation: The laser in an optical drive must be able to accurately read the microscopic pits on a disc. If the laser head's lens is obstructed by dust or smudges, it can cause read errors. Cleaning the lens with a specialized cleaning disc or compressed air is a common first step in troubleshooting a non-functional optical drive.

question: A technician upgraded the memory on a server from two 8GB sticks to eight 32GB. The server memory is now at full capacity per the user guide. When the technician attempts to power on the system, it is non-responsive. The technician then removes the RAM upgrade and resets the original configuration. They then decide to upgrade to the latest version of firmware on the system. Next, they install the memory in sets of 64GB at a time. Each individual set of 64GB is fully recognised by the server. Which of the following will allow the server to recognise all of the memory installed at the same time?
options: The server is overheating when all of the memory is installed.
The power supply is not supplying enough power for the memory.
The memory has too many ECC errors and is shutting down.
The server needs to have a sufficient Power Supply installed.
correct_answer: The server needs to have a sufficient Power Supply installed.
explanation: Adding a large number of RAM modules significantly increases the overall power consumption of the system. The fact that the server powers on with a partial upgrade but fails to boot with all modules installed is a strong indicator that the power supply unit (PSU) cannot provide enough wattage to support the fully populated memory configuration. Upgrading to a more powerful PSU is required.

question: Your company wants to use USB 3.0-compatible external hard drives and needs to update existing workstations. As a system administrator, which of the following changes would you recommend to save the most time and money?
explanation: The most efficient and cost-effective method to add newer port types like USB 3.0 to an existing desktop computer is to install a PCIe expansion card. This is a simple upgrade that provides the desired functionality without the significant cost and effort of replacing the entire motherboard.

question: A user reports that a laptop is not connecting to the corporate wireless network. A technician confirms, using a smartphone, that the corporate wireless network is available and accessible. The technician observes that the Ethernet connection to the corporate network is working. The technician disconnects the Ethernet cable. Which of the following should the technician do next to troubleshoot this problem?
options: Confirm that the laptop wireless card is turned on.
Confirm the user’s network login ID and password.
Confirm that the laptop is in range for the access point.
Confirm that the correct wireless network is selected.
correct_answer: Confirm that the laptop wireless card is turned on.
explanation: After verifying the network is working and the laptop has wired connectivity, the most fundamental step is to check the laptop's own hardware. Many laptops have a physical switch or a function key combination (e.g., Fn + F2) that toggles the wireless adapter on and off. Ensuring the card is enabled is the most logical next step before investigating more complex software or configuration issues.

question: A server needs a RAM upgrade, and a technician has been tasked with retrieving the RAM from storage and then installing it. Which of the following is the BEST RAM type for the technician to retrieve?
explanation: Servers require maximum stability and data integrity. ECC (Error-Correcting Code) memory is the industry standard for servers because it contains special hardware that can detect and correct single-bit memory errors in real time. This prevents data corruption and system crashes, which is critical in a server environment.

question: A technician has been informed that multiple users are receiving duplicate IP address warnings on their workstations, and they are unable to browse the Internet. Which of the following server types should the technician log in to in order to resolve the problem?
explanation: The DHCP (Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol) server is responsible for automatically assigning unique IP addresses to devices on a network. When multiple users receive "duplicate IP address" errors, it indicates a problem with this assignment process. The technician needs to investigate the DHCP server for issues like an exhausted address pool or a misconfiguration.

question: An end-user has signed up to use a web-based calendar application. Which of the following solutions has the user purchased?
explanation: SaaS stands for Software as a Service. This is a cloud computing model where users access software applications over the internet, typically on a subscription basis. A web-based calendar is a prime example of SaaS, as the provider hosts and manages the application, and the user simply accesses it through a web browser.

question: Joe, a user, has purchased a new mobile device that uses a different OS than his previous one. Joe wants to copy his contacts and appointments from his corporate account, without entering them manually. Which of the following would be the best way for a technician to assist Joe?
options: Log into the same email provider on the new device, and restore the contacts and dates.
Create a Bluetooth connection between Joe’s devices, and copy his contacts and calendar.
Back-up the old mobile device to a PC, and import the contacts and schedule from the PC.
Use NFC to transfer all compatible data from one device to the other.
correct_answer: Log into the same email provider on the new device, and restore the contacts and dates.
explanation: Corporate email accounts (like Microsoft 365 or Google Workspace) are cloud-based and sync data across devices. The most reliable and platform-independent method for transferring contacts and calendar information is to simply add the corporate account to the new device. The device will then automatically synchronize all the necessary data from the cloud server.

question: Which of the following is caused by dust being trapped in the cooling passages?
explanation: A computer's cooling system relies on airflow through heatsinks and fans to remove heat from critical components. When dust accumulates in these passages, it acts as an insulator, restricting airflow and preventing proper heat dissipation. This leads to components running at higher-than-normal temperatures, a condition known as overheating.

question: A technician replaced a broken LED screen on a mobile computer. The operating system can be seen perfectly on screen, but the touch screen is non-responsive. Which of the following are the most probable root causes for the given failure? (Select THREE).
options: The touch screen must be calibrated after a replacement.
The digitizer cable is not seated properly on the motherboard.
The LCD panel firmware must be updated.
The grounding screws are not securely attached.
The hardware replacement used is non-touch-screen.
The new touch-screen drivers must be installed.
correct_answer: The hardware replacement used is non-touch-screen.
The digitizer cable is not seated properly on the motherboard.
The new touch-screen drivers must be installed.
explanation:
When a display works but touch input does not, the problem is isolated to the touch component (the digitizer). The most common causes are:
Hardware Mismatch: The technician may have accidentally installed a standard non-touch screen instead of the required touch-screen model.
Physical Connection Issue: The digitizer has its own separate, small ribbon cable that connects to the motherboard. If this cable is loose, disconnected, or damaged, the touch functionality will not work.
Software/Driver Issue: The new hardware may require specific drivers to be installed for the operating system to recognize and use its touch capabilities.

question: A technician is talking to end users about the specifications for an upgraded application server. The users of the application report that there cannot be any unscheduled downtime or data loss. Additionally, they would like the performance of the application to improve over the previous server, in any way possible, while keeping redundancy. The previous server running was RAID 5 configured. Which of the following RAID solutions should be implemented in this scenario?
explanation: RAID 10 (a stripe of mirrors) is the ideal choice for these requirements. It combines the speed of RAID 0 (striping data across multiple disks) with the redundancy of RAID 1 (mirroring data). This configuration provides a significant boost to both read and write performance compared to RAID 5, while also offering excellent fault tolerance, thus meeting the user's needs for improved performance and high availability.

question: A user reports that printing on heavy card stock paper results in the image smearing if touched. When printing on plain paper, this problem does not occur. Which of the following would be the next troubleshooting step to perform?
explanation: In a laser printer, the fuser unit uses heat to melt the toner onto the paper. Smearing indicates that the toner is not being properly bonded. Heavy paper like card stock absorbs more heat and requires a higher fuser temperature to achieve a permanent bond. The next step is to go into the printer's settings and change the paper type to "Card Stock" or "Heavy Paper," which will automatically increase the fuser's operating temperature.

question: A technician needs to routinely run scripting commands in Linux, but does not want to walk over to the server room each time to perform the task. The technician also travels between buildings and has a Windows 10 laptop with 4GB of memory and a fully partitioned 500GB hard drive. Which of the following steps should the technician take to resolve this issue? (Select TWO).
options: Remove Windows 10 and Install a version of Linux on the Laptop.
explanation:
To run a Linux environment on a Windows laptop without altering the existing installation, the two best options are:
Install a Linux guest VM: Using virtualization software (like VirtualBox or Hyper-V), the technician can run a complete Linux operating system inside a window on their desktop. This is ideal for frequent use.
Create a Linux LiveBoot CD/USB: This allows the technician to boot the laptop directly into a fully functional but temporary Linux environment from the bootable media, without touching the hard drive. (Note: An SSH client like PuTTY would be the most direct way to run commands on the server, but of the options provided, these two are the correct methods for running a Linux environment on the laptop).

question: An end user reports a printer error that states 'Replace filament'. Which of the following types of printer is the end user most likely having problems with?
explanation: Filament is the raw material, typically a spool of plastic thread, used in the most common type of 3-D printer (Fused Deposition Modeling). Laser printers use toner, inkjet printers use liquid ink, and thermal printers use heat-sensitive paper or ribbons.

question: A customer asks a technician to help them set up a specialised computing system for video editing. Which of the following should the technician install on the workstation to best meet the customer’s specifications? (Select TWO).
explanation:
For a high-performance video editing workstation, two of the most impactful components are:
SSD (Solid-State Drive): Video editing involves constant reading and writing of very large files. An SSD provides dramatically faster data access than a traditional hard drive, which speeds up everything from loading the application and source files to rendering the final video.
Dual Monitors: A multi-monitor setup significantly enhances workflow and productivity. An editor can have the project timeline on one screen while viewing a full-screen preview, effects controls, or file bins on the second screen.

question: Which of the following can be used to connect multiple devices while broadcasting to every network port? (Select all that apply.)
explanation:
A Hub is a simple Layer 1 device that operates as a single broadcast domain. Any data it receives on one port is unintelligently repeated and sent out to every other port.
An Unmanaged Switch is a Layer 2 device that is smarter than a hub, as it directs traffic between specific ports based on MAC addresses. However, it will still forward broadcast traffic (messages intended for all devices on the network) to all of its ports by design.

question: A customer wants to upgrade a PC’s internal storage to have more room to store backups, photos, and videos. The new storage should be large enough to avoid expanding again next year and kept within a reasonable budget. Which of the following best meets these needs?
explanation: The key requirements are large capacity and a reasonable budget. A 3TB HDD (Hard Disk Drive) provides a vast amount of storage space for large media files. HDDs offer a much lower cost-per-gigabyte than SSDs, making them the best choice for budget-conscious bulk storage. A SAN is an expensive enterprise solution, and the other capacity options are too small.

question: Which of the following display types does not use an inverter? (Select TWO).
options: LCD (Liquid Crystal Display) TFT (Thin Film Transistor)
LCD (Liquid Crystal Display) with LED (Light Emitting Diode)
correct_answer: LCD (Liquid Crystal Display) with LED (Light Emitting Diode)
explanation:
An inverter is a component that converts DC power to the high-voltage AC power needed to power a CCFL (Cold Cathode Fluorescent Lamp) backlight.
LED-backlit LCDs use Light Emitting Diodes for their backlight. LEDs run on low-voltage DC power and therefore do not require an inverter.
OLED screens are emissive, meaning each pixel creates its own light. They do not have a backlight at all, so they have no need for an inverter.

question: Multiple users report that the network printer, which is connected through the print server, is not printing. Which of the following should a technician do first to remedy this situation?
options: Reinstall the drivers on users’ PCs.
explanation: When a shared network printer stops working for everyone, the most common culprit is a single stuck or corrupted print job on the print server. This job blocks all subsequent jobs from being processed. The fastest and most direct first step is to access the print server and clear the entire print queue, which removes the offending job and allows printing to resume.

question: A Mac user would like to print to the company's network printers. Which of the following support printing from Apple devices? (Select TWO).
explanation:
AirPrint is Apple's driverless printing technology that allows Macs and iOS devices to print to compatible printers on the same network without needing to install specific printer drivers.
Bonjour is Apple's zero-configuration networking protocol. It enables devices to automatically discover services, including printers, on a local network. A network printer will use Bonjour to advertise its availability to Mac users.

question: A technician is setting up a Windows mobile device for a user who had trouble reading text on a previous device. Which of the following adjustments would be most appropriate?
explanation: The magnifier is an accessibility tool built into Windows specifically to address difficulty in reading text. It allows the user to zoom in on parts of the screen, making text and other interface elements larger and easier to see. Increasing the resolution would make text smaller, while haptic feedback and text-to-speech do not assist with visual reading.

question: Which of the following should the systems administrator do to reduce the number of help-desk tickets submitted?
explanation: A significant volume of help desk tickets are related to forgotten passwords and account lockouts. Single Sign-On (SSO) simplifies the user experience by allowing them to log in once to access multiple applications. By reducing the number of passwords a user needs to remember, SSO drastically decreases the frequency of password-related help desk requests.

question: A server administrator set up a VM to be used in a lab setting. A technician is setting up thin-clients to access this VM. Which of the following tasks are required in order to complete the project? (Select all that apply.)
options: Connect the device to the network.
Connect the device to a printer.
Install a USB keyboard and mouse.
Connect the device to a monitor.
correct_answer: Connect the device to the network.
explanation:
To make a thin client functional for accessing a remote VM, a technician must perform these key tasks:
Connect the device to the network: This is a fundamental requirement for the thin client to communicate with the server hosting the VM.
Install the latest system updates: The thin client's own embedded operating system must be updated to ensure security and compatibility.
Install the necessary applications: This refers to installing the specific remote desktop client software (e.g., RDP client, Citrix Workspace, VMware Horizon Client) that is needed to establish a connection to the VM.

question: Which of the following is the current standard for connecting a DDR3 SODIMM RAM Module to a PC motherboard?
explanation: The JEDEC standard for DDR3 SODIMM modules, which are used in laptops and other small form-factor devices, specifies a 204-pin connector. The standard voltage for DDR3 is 1.5V, while the low-voltage DDR3L variant runs at 1.35V.

question: The company you work for allows users to request an additional Solid State Drive (SSD) by submitting a help desk ticket. Occasionally, after receiving the upgraded computer, a user will report that they are unable to see the new drive. What has the technician likely forgotten to do in these instances?
options: Connect the cable to the motherboard.
explanation: After a new storage drive is physically installed in a Windows computer, it is not automatically visible in File Explorer. The technician must use the Disk Management tool to first initialize the disk, and then create a new partition and format it with a file system (like NTFS). This process assigns a drive letter and makes the drive accessible to the operating system.

question: Whenever a user’s machine is turned on, a black screen appears prompting them for an administrative password. The technician has no such password on file for this machine. Which of the following steps should the technician take to resolve this issue?
options: Disconnect and reconnect the internal hard drive.
Remove the CMOS battery and reinsert it after ten seconds.
Press and hold the CPU power button for five seconds, and then power back on.
Remove the motherboard and place it back into the machine after ten minutes.
correct_answer: Remove the CMOS battery and reinsert it after ten seconds.
explanation: A password prompt that appears before the operating system begins to load is a BIOS/UEFI password. These settings are stored in CMOS memory, which is powered by a small battery on the motherboard. The standard procedure to clear a forgotten BIOS password is to temporarily remove the CMOS battery. This cuts power to the CMOS memory, resetting all BIOS/UEFI settings, including the password, to their factory defaults.

question: Which of the following is the current standard for connecting internal mass storage devices to a PC motherboard?
explanation: For many years, SATA (Serial ATA) has been the universal standard for connecting internal 2.5-inch and 3.5-inch storage drives, including both hard disk drives (HDDs) and solid-state drives (SSDs). While newer M.2 form factor SSDs often use the faster PCIe interface, SATA remains the primary connection type for traditional internal drives.

question: A user accidentally spills liquid on a laptop. The user wants the device to be fixed and would like to know how much it will cost. Which of the following steps should the technician take next, to verify if the device is repairable, before committing to a price? (Select TWO).
options: Remove the case and review damaged parts.
Search the Internet for repair tutorials.
correct_answer: Remove the case and review damaged parts.
explanation:
To accurately assess liquid damage and provide an estimate, the technician must physically inspect the internal components. This requires two key steps:
Document the screw locations: As a best practice during any disassembly, carefully tracking the location of all screws is essential for proper reassembly later.
Remove the case and review damaged parts: This is the critical diagnostic step. The technician needs to see which components (motherboard, keyboard, connectors, etc.) show signs of corrosion or short-circuiting to determine what needs to be replaced and if the repair is economically feasible.

question: After purchasing a wireless printer and completing the setup in an office, including the installation of all required printer software on the computer and connecting the printer to the guest wireless network, the user encounters an issue where no printing action occurs upon attempting to print. Which of the following will resolve the issue?
options: Configure the printer to use the Internet printing protocol.
Set up the user’s computer to act as a print server.
Connect the printer to the company wireless network.
Ensure the user’s computer is set to DHCP.
correct_answer: Connect the printer to the company wireless network.
explanation: For a computer and a printer to communicate on a network, they must be on the same network segment. Guest wireless networks are almost always isolated from the internal company network for security purposes. This isolation prevents devices on the guest network (the printer) from communicating with devices on the company network (the user's computer). The solution is to connect the printer to the same company wireless network that the computer is using.

question: A user is unable to access websites and has reported connectivity issues with pop-ups on the screen. A technician removes malware and is then able to ping the router and access websites. Which of the following steps should the technician perform next when troubleshooting this issue? (Select TWO).
options: Research the problem based on symptoms.
Reconnect the device to the network.
Reboot the device to verify the fix.
explanation:
After performing an initial fix, the troubleshooting process requires verification and documentation:
Run a virus scan: Removing the malware that caused the initial symptoms does not guarantee the system is completely clean. Performing a full, updated antivirus scan is essential to find and remove any remaining threats.
Document findings, actions, and outcomes: This is a critical final step in any professional IT procedure. Documenting what was found, what was done, and the result creates a record for future reference and helps track patterns of issues.

question: A projector’s image begins to flicker during a presentation. The laptop display does not produce this issue. When a technician changes the resolution on the laptop, the issue persists. Which of the following is the next step the technician should take?
options: Check the connectivity of the VGA cable.
Change the aspect ratio on the laptop.
Check the connectivity of the power cable.
Change the settings of the projector.
correct_answer: Check the connectivity of the VGA cable.
explanation: Since the laptop's built-in display works correctly, the problem is isolated to the connection between the laptop and the projector. A flickering image is a very common symptom of a loose or faulty video cable. The simplest and most logical first step is to check that the VGA cable is securely fastened at both the laptop and projector ports.

question: A business owner wants to provide security to laptop users with the ability to charge their devices, access corporate LAN resources, and allow for a variety of their removable hardware. Which of the following devices would best meet the owner’s needs?
explanation: A docking station is an all-in-one solution that meets all the specified requirements. It provides power to charge the laptop, an Ethernet port for wired LAN access, multiple USB ports for peripherals, video outputs, and often a physical security lock slot, all consolidated through a single connection to the laptop.

question: A client has three locations, within city limits, that need to be networked. Vendor network requirements, for all three locations, are a minimum of 1GB. Which of the following are the types of networks that will most likely be used for internal office and office-to-office networking? (Select TWO).
explanation:
LAN (Local Area Network): This network exists within each of the three office buildings, connecting the computers and devices at that single location.
MAN (Metropolitan Area Network): This is the network that connects the three separate office LANs to each other across the city. A MAN is specifically designed to span a geographic area like a city.

question: A company has very strict rules regarding proprietary information leaving the premises. All computers host proprietary information. A technician is called to repair a computer on-site at the company’s corporate office. Having identified the troubleshooting steps to create a plan of action, the technician determines that the computer needs to be taken off-site for repair. Which of the following should the technician do next?
options: Remove the HDD and send the device for repair.
Delete proprietary data before leaving the building.
explanation: When dealing with proprietary or sensitive information, a technician's actions must be governed by the company's established rules. Before removing any equipment, the first and most important step is to consult the official corporate policies. This ensures that the technician follows the correct, authorized procedure for handling equipment containing sensitive data, which may involve getting specific approvals or removing storage drives.

question: A technician is setting up a VM for use in testing software deployments. The VM is offline, but the hypervisor is not. Which of the following settings should the technician change to resolve this issue?
explanation: A VM being "offline" is analogous to a physical computer being powered off. The core component that begins the boot process is the CPU. To bring the VM "online," the technician must start the VM, which allocates the virtual CPU and other resources, initiating the power-on sequence.

question: Which of the following terminates a coaxial cable?
explanation: This question is slightly imprecise, as RG-59 is a standard for a type of coaxial cable itself, not the connector. However, among the given choices, it is the only term directly associated with coaxial cabling. The connectors used to terminate RG-59 cable are typically BNC or F-type connectors. The other options are for different cable types (RJ45 for Ethernet, RS-232/DB9 for serial).

question: Which network connector is commonly used to connect telephones and DSL networks?
explanation: The RJ-11 is the standard modular connector found on the end of telephone cords. Since DSL internet service operates over standard telephone lines, the RJ-11 connector is used to plug the modem into the telephone wall jack. It is visibly smaller than the RJ-45 connector used for Ethernet.

question: A technician is ordering a new motherboard and processors for a company email server. When reviewing the vendor licensing agreement, the technician sees that there is a flat per-socket licensing fee. Which of the following motherboard/processor combinations should the technician order to get the best performance while minimising licensing fees?
options: A single-processor motherboard with ten overclocked cores.
A single-processor motherboard with hyper-threaded eight cores.
A dual-processor motherboard with six hyper-threaded cores each.
A dual-processor motherboard with eight overclocked cores each.
correct_answer: A single-processor motherboard with ten overclocked cores.
explanation: The licensing fee is based on the number of physical CPU sockets. To minimize this fee, the technician must choose a single-processor (one socket) motherboard. To maximize performance within that single socket, the best option is the CPU with the highest core count and clock speed. A ten-core overclocked CPU will provide more raw computing power than an eight-core CPU, making it the best performance choice for the single licensing fee.

question: A technician was called to check an unexpected clicking noise on a desktop that has become more frequent every time a video editing application is loaded. The system fans have been replaced, but the clicking noise remains. Diagnostics have been run on the video card. Which of the following should the technician do first?
explanation:
A persistent clicking noise that is not from the fans is a very strong indicator of a failing mechanical hard drive.
The absolute first and most critical action is to perform a full data backup. This is to protect the user's data before the drive fails completely and the data becomes unrecoverable.
While less likely to cause a physical clicking noise, malware can cause extreme hard drive activity. Scanning for viruses is a reasonable diagnostic step to rule out software causes.

question: A new user has been issued a laptop. They are not very tech savvy and require some assistance with adjusting the laptop screen's brightness. What is the easiest and quickest way for the user to adjust the brightness?
explanation: The most direct and user-friendly way to change screen brightness on a laptop is by using the keyboard shortcut. This typically involves holding down the Fn (Function) key while pressing another key in the F1-F12 row that is marked with a brightness symbol (often a sun icon).

question: A user calls to report a computer that is failing to boot. Upon inspection of the computer, you notice that there is a Universal Serial Bus (USB) thumb drive attached to the laptop. You suspect this may be the cause of the issue. What can you do to test this theory and then solve the problem?
options: Remove the USB and attempt to boot the computer.
Review previous tickets that the user submitted.
Question the user about what has changed recently on the system.
Check the device boot order in the BIOS.
correct_answer: Remove the USB and attempt to boot the computer.
explanation: If a computer's BIOS is configured to prioritize booting from USB devices, it will attempt to load an operating system from any connected USB drive. If that drive is not bootable, the system will hang or show a boot failure error. The simplest and quickest way to test this is to remove the USB drive and try to power on the computer again.

question: A customer accidentally drops a laptop while it is charging. The next day, the customer notices the laptop will not turn on and calls a technician to investigate. The technician confirms that the laptop will not turn on, even though it is connected to the power adapter. Which of the following components is most likely to have caused this behaviour?
explanation: The DC jack is the internal power port on the laptop where the charger connects. When a laptop is dropped while plugged in, the impact often breaks the DC jack or its connection to the motherboard. A broken DC jack will prevent the laptop from receiving power from the adapter and from charging the battery, leading to a complete failure to turn on.

question: Which of the following devices is used to implement network security policies for an environment?
explanation: A firewall is a network security device that monitors and controls incoming and outgoing network traffic based on a predetermined set of security rules (policies). Its primary purpose is to establish a barrier between a trusted internal network and untrusted external networks to block malicious traffic.

question: You set up a Redundant Array of Independent Disks (RAID) level 1 on a system, to mirror the hard disk. After rebooting the system, you receive an error and find that a disk has failed. What action do you take?
options: Backup the data on the active disk.
Use third-party software to recover data from the active disk.
explanation: RAID 1 (mirroring) provides redundancy by writing identical data to two drives. When one drive fails, the system continues to run on the remaining drive, but it is no longer fault-tolerant. The correct and necessary action is to replace the failed disk promptly so the RAID controller can rebuild the mirror and restore the system's redundancy.

question: Which of the following is the most likely cause for a network PC to have an APIPA address?
explanation: APIPA (Automatic Private IP Addressing) is a feature in Windows where a device assigns itself an IP address from the 169.254.x.x range. This occurs specifically when the device is configured to get an IP address automatically but cannot communicate with a DHCP server on the network. It is a direct symptom of a DHCP failure.

question: Which of the following technologies can be used for wireless payments?
explanation: NFC (Near Field Communication) is a very short-range wireless technology that enables communication between two devices when they are brought within a few centimeters of each other. This "tap-to-connect" functionality is the core technology behind modern contactless payment systems like Apple Pay and Google Pay.

question: You are considering a computer for use as a host in a virtual environment. Which of the following is not a virtualisation-specific hardware feature?
explanation: Intel VT-x, AMD-V, and Second Level Address Translation (SLAT) are all hardware technologies developed specifically to improve the performance and efficiency of virtualization. Hyperthreading, in contrast, is a general CPU technology that allows a single physical core to function as two logical cores for the operating system. While beneficial for virtualization, it is not exclusive to it.

question: A customer wants to purchase a new home computer. The machine will mainly be used for internal browsing and streaming videos, except on weekends when the customer's son will use it to play games with friends. Which of the following should the technician focus on to meet these requirements?
explanation: The combination of light daily tasks and more demanding weekend gaming points to the CPU as a critical component. A four-core processor provides a strong foundation that can easily handle web browsing and video streaming, while also offering the multi-threaded performance needed for modern games. This makes it the most important component to focus on from the list.

question: During an inspection, it was found that data racks were not properly grounded. To pass the inspection, and address growing concerns about protecting data cabling and equipment, technicians must ensure all racks are properly grounded. Which of the following tools should the technician use to verify this has been completed?
explanation: A multimeter is the correct tool for this task. To verify a ground, a technician would set the multimeter to the continuity or resistance (Ohms) setting. By touching one probe to the server rack and the other to a known good grounding point (like a grounding bar or copper pipe), the multimeter will confirm if there is a low-resistance electrical path, thus verifying a proper ground.

question: You are configuring the mail app on an iPhone to use an Outlook.com email address. What configuration information do you need to enter to establish connectivity?
options: Email address, password, and server name
Email address, password, server name, and mail protocol
Email address, password, server name or IP address, and mail protocol
explanation: When configuring a mobile email client to access a commercial email provider, you typically just need your username and password to establish connectivity. Examples include Google, Yahoo, Outlook.com, and iCloud.

question: Which type of smartphone display has fewer layers, providing more flexibility, a better viewing angle, and excellent color as compared to other technologies?
explanation: Many newer smartphones are boasting OLED displays for their light weight, flexibility, color depth, and wider viewing angle. IPS is a popular type of LCD (Liquid Crystal Display) that requires backlighting to display the image. TN was the LCD technology developed first. It uses less power and has a limited viewing angle, but it supports very fast refresh rates. LEDs can be used as the backlight for LCD systems. OLED displays don't need a backlight because their carbon-based material can emit light and color.

question: In which scenario would you use the Fn key and the F10 key?
options: To turn the screen brightness down
To turn the screen brightness up
To turn the speaker volume down
To turn the speaker volume up
correct_answer: To turn the screen brightness up
explanation: Some laptop keys are consolidated into special multifunction keys to save valuable space. These keys are accessed through the standard keys by using a special function (Fn) key. Video adjustments come in two varieties: changing the video output and dimming or brightening the screen. In this case, there is a large sun icon for brightening the screen on the F10 key, so pressing the Fn key and the F10 key simultaneously would increase the brightness. Some laptops use a smaller sun to label the key for dimming and a larger sun to label the key for brightening, or they use plus and minus signs or up and down arrows next to the suns. You may also see special function keys to turn network connections on or off or to play, fast-forward, or rewind media.

question: You are purchasing a mobile device that allows you to use multi-finger gestures to interact with the device. What type of touchscreen technology does this device most likely use?
explanation: Capacitive touchscreens are a little less accurate than resistive touchscreens but more responsive. They respond to changes in electrical current, and as such, the human fingertip works great as the facilitator of input. Resistive screens require a heavier touch and don't support multi-touch input. Infrared screens don't work with multi-touch gestures, but like resistive screens, they can be used with gloves on. Surface Acoustic Wave (SAW) is another type of touchscreen, but it is not popular.

question: You are using a public Wi-Fi hotspot and believe that someone is trying to hack into your laptop. Which laptop feature should you use to immediately turn off all wireless connections?
explanation: Airplane mode turns off all wireless connections on a mobile device. It's common on phones and tablets, and most laptops have the feature as well.

question: You have been asked to purchase a new camera for the company photographer. Some of the cameras are marketed as "smart" cameras. What key feature does this likely mean the camera includes?
explanation: Smart cameras have built-in wireless network connectivity for easy picture and video transfers. Many will include Wi-Fi, Bluetooth, and Near-Field Communication (NFC). Smart cameras, such as security cameras, can also connect via Wi-Fi to your network and the Internet, and can thus be accessed and controlled by a cell phone.

question: Your friend's iPhone 13 will no longer charge. They have tried replacing the charging block and cable with compatible ones and tested the wall outlet. What should be done next?
options: Take the phone to a repair shop.
correct_answer: Take the phone to a repair shop.
explanation: While it's possible that the phone could be charged with a charging pad, most often phones won't charge because the battery is worn out and needs replacing. Also, according to the Apple Support website, a phone that won't charge likely needs servicing. Your friend should take their phone to a service center. They may be able to replace the battery or fix problems they find with the phone's connector.

question: Your customer brought you a laptop with an internal battery that will no longer charge. You have told them that replacing the battery will be no problem at all. Which of the following will you need to do first?
explanation: Legacy laptops may have a battery that is removable and replaceable by sliding a connector or removing a few screws from the back of the case, but you might not be able to find a compatible replacement. Modern laptops have internal batteries. Before removing the back (bottom) cover of the laptop to get to the battery, you must disconnect the power to avoid getting shocked or damaging the laptop. You'll also want to be certain that you can purchase a compatible battery both in features and size/shape. Most do not require you to remove the keyboard or LCD panel to reach the battery, but again before doing either of those, the power should be disconnected, and you will have researched the laptop.

question: A coworker is having a problem with their laptop and has asked you to fix it. When an external keyboard is plugged in, the laptop works just fine, but without it strange characters appear on the screen when typing. Which of the following are likely causes? (Choose two.)
options: The driver is corrupted and needs to be updated/replaced.
The ribbon cable is partially disconnected and needs to be reseated.
The laptop needs to be replaced.
There is debris under the keys.
correct_answer: The driver is corrupted and needs to be updated/replaced.
The ribbon cable is partially disconnected and needs to be reseated.
explanation: Users should be discouraged from eating cookies or toast (or anything) over their laptops. Fine crumbs or other debris can cause keys to stick, but that likely wouldn't cause the type of problem the user is experiencing. Oftentimes a laptop keyboard can be replaced fairly easily assuming a compatible one can be found, but in this case, the problem is most likely caused by a loose ribbon cable connecting the keyboard to the motherboard, or a corrupted driver.

question: You're working as the IT support person at an accounting firm. One of the accountants dropped their keyboard, and the number 5 key is no longer there. This is a critical problem for an accountant. What is the most cost-effective way to get them up and running again?
options: Replace the laptop with a new one.
Give them a desktop computer to use.
explanation: Individual keys can be replaced on a laptop. If your company uses many of the same model of laptops, keeping one or two nonfunctioning ones in stock for parts is helpful. If a key is not readily available, they can be purchased from third-party vendors for much less than an entire keyboard. When ordering, ensure that it has the right type of clips, hinges, and possibly cup for the model being replaced. Is the short term, an inexpensive USB-connected keypad might suffice.

question: Your boss has asked you to maximize the RAM in their laptop computer. You check the specifications and discover that the maximum system RAM is 32 GB of DDR4 RAM. The laptop currently has 16 GB onboard RAM and one empty slot. Which of the following RAM modules will you purchase?
explanation: You will always check the device's documentation before purchasing components to ensure compatibility. In a laptop, RAM is often soldered directly onto the motherboard (onboard) and isn't meant to be replaced by most users. Since the maximum system RAM is 32 GB, you would need one 16 GB RAM module to bring it up to that total. The SO in SODIMM stands for Small Outline and is the type of RAM module used in devices like laptops and sometimes printers. DIMMs (Dual Inline Memory Modules) are used in desktop computers.

question: A friend is trying to install an update on their iPod, but they're receiving a message about insufficient space. They want to know if you can upgrade their storage. What will you tell them?
options: Sure, bring it over later today.
Storage can't be upgraded. You'll need to buy a new iPod.
Storage can't be upgraded, but you may be able to offload some apps you no longer use.
Just purchase more space on iCloud; it's the same thing.
correct_answer: Storage can't be upgraded, but you may be able to offload some apps you no longer use.
explanation: The short answer is that no, storage on an iPhone, iPad, iPod, or almost any small device can't be upgraded. When you buy one of these devices, it's best to buy as much storage as you can afford. Attaching the device to your PC and doing the upgrade there may work.
